text: Can at home. Copperish-orangeish colour, with a finger of white head with good retention. Nose is light sourness, with definitive whitewine notes. Taste is low bitterness, faint sourness. Longlasting sticky bitter aftertaste. Strong alcoholic warmth. The nose is brilliant, sadly the taste doesnt deliver as much.
On Tap @El Lúpulo Feroz, Oviedo. 10/06/17. Color amarillo oscuro espuma blanca, aromas a madera con notas a fruta y especiados, sabor malta con bretas agradable buen sabor. Agradable cerveza.

14-05-17 // can from Alus Celle, Riga. Hazy golden, minimal orange colour, small white head. Sweet malty body, some fruit notes, vineous character. Belgian yeast, hints of sour notes. Some spices. Very complex.

URUS 3.0
Aroma: citrus, spicy, stone fruits, some barnyard
Taste: medium sweet, light bitter, citrus, spicy, some barnyard/leather, white fruits
Pite na Ursusie. Całkiem fajne, lekka stajnia plus cytrusy. Mocno pijalne. Naprawdę dobre piwo.
Bottle.Muddy orange colour with medium White head.Aroma is fruity and vinious with flavor of greaps and mild yeast,nice smooth mouthfeels and good well balanced finish.
Burk. Gyllengul öl med ett lättare vitt skum. Doften är vinös med lättare humleinslag. I smaken kommer humlen fram betydligt mer med en gräsig, kryddig grapefruktbeska.
What a major disappointment! The beer tastes good but its not dry it all and theres no sign of the hops that I can tell.

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2017 Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Pyszny wild ale z mega wyraźnym charakterem białych winogron. Dość wysokie wysycenie, intensywnie estrowe w stronę owoców, cierpkie skórki winogron na finiszu.

From tap; dark orange with small white head; aroma is fruity, grapes, berries, some aged, wine and barrel characteristics, only a tiny hint of alcohol and malt; taste is fruity sweet, following the aroma, fading into solid hoppy bitterness, no malty sweetness at all; creamy texture with high carbonation and dry body
Puszka w Chmielarni na Marszałkowskiej. Aromat owocowy, smak dosyć wytrawny ale jest też słodycz i kwaśność. Pije się bardzo przyjemnie jak na styl. Bardzo fajne.

Hazy orange with White head. Aroma of citrus, gooseberry and grapes. Fruity and wineous. Notes of oak and brett. Dry and light sour; zesty but finish medium bitter. Complex. Light body and juicy texture. Fizzy carbonation. A great one...

33cl dåse bb12/2017 fresh from Geers. - Supremely dialed (&emailed) in recipe combining the best of greenberry Nelson, a wild tripel-geuze character and sweet grape Sauvignon character - yet more and smoother than the sum of its parts. Very smooth, green grapejuice and apricot mouthfeel, making either wine tannins or that clean Mikkeller DIPA hoppiness work at full throttle. Less alcohol fumes than a Belgian tripel of this boost. A wildly satisfying Gewürztraminer of a DIPA-Tripel.

Very dense head, looks great. Refined Saison aroma, soft sweet, marmelade. Very balanced taste, interesting bubbly actually. Well done brew, touch sweet but the hops are great. (33cl can from Convento)
Can at letra pub porto. Gold orange color. Thin white head. Medium bitterness, light sweetness, light sourness. Medium body. Aroma and flavour is wine, resin, hops, herbs, grape, yeast, citric.
Pours dark orange with a thin line of white head. Aroma Apricots, Belgian yeast, citrus, orange peel and chardonnay. Taste; Orange peels, apricots, Belgian ale yeast, citrus bananas and oak...
A: Dark orange coloured with a huge white head N: Belgian yeast, pineapple, mango, hint of banana, passionfruit T: Mango, orange zest, funk O: Pretty drinkable!
Duft citrus frisk krydret fad kant berettet måske, smag frisk krydret lime appelsin frisk tør vin noder tør

Bottle. One year old. Pours a orange colour with a small off-white head. Fruity aroma of rowan berries, forest floor, oak, dried apricots and some citrus. The flavor is similar with more citrus, oak, hay and apple cider vinegar. A little dry. Has a slick mouth feel, full-bodied and a light bitterness. A fruity, balanced and fresh ale.

75cl bottle shared at Uiltje bar. Somewhat pale golden with a medium white soapy head. Full body with moderate carbonation. Well balanced bitter, sour and sweet tones. Yeast, white wine, grapes, oak and tart. Very good.

Draft glass @ Gollem. Finally I get tot this one. Lightly hazy amber / orange, creamy faintly tanned head. Nose is rich wine, funky wine, big brett, orange peel, toffee, sweet wine, malt sweetness on top, unique sweet & funk, caramelized carrot, fermenting white grapes,... Taste is sweet toffee, orange, candy, caramelized candy, sweetness mixed with the funk, toffee, big orange peel, white grape, some sugar, brett in the middle, funky grapes, intense mix of many things, finish is bitter on top, fruit,... Carries a combo of so many things, orange peel, funky grapes, brett, bitter finsh,... Body is toffee, orange peel, sugar, highly interesting version. I preferred the Chardonnay BA version which I tried prior to this one, I am curious to try some other versions. Big malt, sugar, toffee dont make it dry like the description promises, I do not care but this would have probably been better if dry.
Bottle at tasting. Aroma of white wine, yeast, oak and soft tart. Taste has white wine, soft brett, tart, yeast, oak and a smooth finish. Elegant and tasty.

Can. 
Clear golden pour, small white head. 
Very floral nose, hints of grapes. Slightly sour taste, with a nice floral finish. 
Light sour finish, medium body, soft carbonation.

On tap at Uiltje Bar, Haarlem during Mikkeller tap takeover. 
Nose is weed. 
Body is clear orange amber, head is small, beige, creamy, mostly lasting, excellent lacing. 
Aroma is tropical fruits, smoke, weed, leaves, malt, old wood, spices. 
Light sweet, medium to heavy bitter. 
Finish is long lasting hoppy and malty medium to heavy bitter. 
Medium to full body, slick texture, nearly flat carbonation. 
Bit heavy, strong flavor, bit overhopped, very tasty, very good.

Draft at Uiltje bar, Haarlem. Almost clear amber with a small head. Aroma of grassy hops, light citrus fruity, white wine, light caramel. Taste is moderate bitter and sweet, bitter hoppy aftertaste. Nice.
Very nice beer made with champagne yeast. A good balance between hops and the white wine cask.

Ljus bärnsten, grumlig med stort vitt skum. Fruktig doft med inslag av gräs och örter och syrlighet från bret och vin. Smaken är syrlig och fruktig, aningen stallig, örter och gräs, lite fatkaraktär, mycket komplex. En väldigt speciell öl, mycket god och spännande.
Bottle. Amber color. Aroma: oak, wine, floral, Chardonnay, a little sweetness. Taste: white wine, a bit sour and sweet, very good.

Bottle enjoyed at home
Copper hazy, creamy beige head. Smell of sauvignon graoes, yeast esters, nelson hops, some citrus, light malts, spices, white wine!. Light sweet, spicy, white wine and sauvignon, oak, herbs, citrus, very complex. Dry mouthfeel, some wine acids, moderate bitter. World class beer

Bottle. Pours amber, with dense white head and perfect lacing. Aromas of white wine, white fruits, subtly sweet, with some wild notes. Taste is lightly sweet, with well marked bitterness. Excellent beer.

Flaske 750ml fra Vinmonopolet Tromsø - Langnes. Drukket i hyggelig selskap under Storflaskesesjon på Nerstranda 5 Nov 16. Aprikosfarget. Filmskum. Heftig aroma av aprikos & plommer. Smaken frisk syrlig frukt.
From bottleshare. Lots of apple, brett, yeasts, grape, a bit cidery. Vinous character.

Bottle 750ml.
Pours copperish with high frothy off-white head. Good lacing. Aroma is of wine, fruits, peaches, slight hints of yogurt. Taste is of peaches, alcohol, bitterness, fruits. Interesting yeast. Palate: Medium body, soft carbonation. Overall: Good, but a bit weird.

Pours a very clear amber with a medium-high white head that leaves very nice lacing. Nose is of grass, peaches, wine/icewine impressions with some (expected) alcohol kick. Taste is also reminescent of peaches and is only lightly sweet. Really juicy and fun to drink. Body is moderately light for a tripel, carbonation moderate and the mouthfeel is certainly vinous. A very light alcohol warmth concludes the experience. A very nice vinous tripel with some nice peachy white wine flavors.

bottle shared by mathieuc, many thanks bro! pours unclear copper-orange with a reviving off-white cap, some retention and lacing. juicy mangoes, tons of tropical nectars, fat golden white grapes, very very winey - californian chardonnay; candies, lots of bretts and other funky bugs; salt. bright carbonation, medium body - oily; semi-sweet woodsy-spicy finish. like a tasty succulent tokaji aszu.

Golden color with off-white head. Aroma has nice brett notes with peach, apricot, white grapes and pineapple. Taste follows with fruit notes, slight farmhouse funk and floral yeast notes. Light, dry body with medium carbonation. Really well made, dry fruity ale.

A lovely brassy orange gold with a nose that is very wheaty, caramel, orange blossoms. Medium to full bodied. Its got a musty flavor with orange blossoms accents. Good but not as great as most at FoFa.

Bottle ordered from Vinmonopolet, Norway. Expensive bottle and high ratings mean high expectations, what do we have here? Pours hazy orange with some white head retention if you shake the glass. Aroma is very estery, pears and roses in abundance. Mouthfeel is pretty good, and we have a flavour that is intensely complex. First off the appearance of solvent was imminent, but it soon gave way to a subdued sour taste blended with dry white wine and some champagne carbonization. This was a great new experience, and is thoroughly recommended.

On tap at the new Mikkeller Oakland. 
Aroma is malty with lots of sweet caramel, candi sugar and honey. Moderate Belgian esters with some overripe stone fruit and pear with hints of banana. Some light nelson saving notes with hints of white wine. 
Pours a somewhat clear, copper color with a medium sized, thick white head that recedes to a thin film that lingers. Moderately high lacing and small legs. 
Flavor is moderately sweet with quite a bit of caramel. Lighter candi sugar and honey notes. Medium low bitterness with some light alcohol notes. Moderate nelson notes with light white wine characteristics. Some moderate Belgian esters with a bit of overripe stone fruit and hints of red apple. 
Mouthfeel is medium full bodied with medium low carbonation. Low astringency and low, but present alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a nice beer. Good ester notes with complimentary white wine and hop characteristics. Nice bright malt notes with the alcohol well hidden.
(En fût à Mikkeller San Diego): Poire flambée, poivre, raisins verts, vin blanc gras et finale ultra sèche et épicée.
UPDATED: JAN 29, 2017 Orange color with large white head. Aroma of fruit - oranges, citrus and yeast. Sweet taste with an acidic bite, vinous, orange peel and a hoppy finish.

(2011 bottle) Im just going to go straight there and say that I really wanted a fuller bigger mouthfeel in this, just more punch. Love the aroma and the look, the beer itself builds as it warms in the glass, and the alcohol tang gets a foot in the door. But it has understated sweetness that lifts i.e. above that background sourness and the overall beer is dry rather than crisp. So pleased Ive had this, would buy other years if I was a rich man :-)

Bottle shared by NickD717, 5/15/16. Bright, clear orange color with a lively head. Tropical fruit and wine on the aroma. Flavor is similar with a bit of a dry, funkiness to the finish. Heavily carbonated as was the intention, but still hurts the drinkability a bit. Barrel notes as mild, but present. Really nice stuff, the flavor is especially quite nice.

660ml bottle served in a tulip glass shared at PiBar - Lausanne.
A: Pours a cloudy orange color forming a medium light yellow head with good retention and lots of lingering molasses lacings left in the glass. 
S: Nose id impressive. Very complex. Very sweet and fruity. Strong notes of caramel and tropical fruits: mango, tangerine, pineapple, coconut and grape. Hints of oak, honey and vanilla. Slightly tartiness. 
T: Taste follows the nose. Just great. Sweet. Strong notes of caramel and tropical fruits: mango, tangerine, pineapple, coconut and grape. Hints of oak, honey and vanilla. Medium hops bitterness. Grassy and very fruity hops profile. Nelson Sauvin hops are really a must here. Slightly tart and metallic finish. 
M: Full body. Medium carbonation. Sweet caramel and tropical fruits in the aftertaste. Pineapple-coconut pie. Slightly tart too. 
O: Excellent drinkability. Masterpiece.

Large bottle from Plumpjack. Brilliant appearance, clear deep copper with a lacy white head. The aroma is stellar, very complex. Light fruits, tropical, mango, papaya, tangerine, white grape, honey, some oak. Medium sweet, champagne like yet sweeter and maltier, complex flavor. Long finish. Medium plus bodied, slightly sticky, well carbonated. Really good!

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2016 Bottle at Eulogy. Slightly hazy amber pour with giant soapy frothy beige head. A smattering of lace. Strong deep red fruity floral sour. Blood oranges. Passionfruit. Papaya. Tangerine. Guava. Delicate but substantial. Hints of earth. Chanterelles. Thyme. Medium body. Grows in complexity as it warms. Great stuff!

Amber, hazy. Low lingering head. Aroma tart cherries, cork, white wine, vinegar. Palate medium, carbonation medium to low. Taste tropic fruit at first : lychee, mango, pineapple, giving way to intense dessert wine sweet and sour finish. My jaw dropped how good this actually is!

Keg at BD Bush, 09/05/16.
Very lightly hated orange amber with a well sized cream cap that retains well. 
Nose is juicy Nelson hops, passionfruit, tangerine, orange pith, candied fruit peel, light yeast esters, bubblegum.
Taste comprises candied fruit peel, ripe melon, grassy, white grape, juicy Nelson licks, candyfloss, wheaten bread, light booze tunes.
Medium + body, fine carbonation, semi drying close with added boost.
Solid for style, subtle undertones ... not just a sweet booze bomb !
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Various bottles 2011-2016. Consistently amazing, in this reviewers opinion Mikkellers best beer to date. Brett, champagne, oak. Delicious.
Gylden brun klar med høyt kremete beige skum. Lukter druer, fudge, røde bær, mot solbær. Frisk lukt. Smaken er fruktig, bæraktig i starten, sursyrlig smak utover, noe vinøs. Tørr avslutning.

Draft at Mikkeller and Friends in Reykjavik The ale poured a cloudy amber with an off white head and lacing. The aroma was complex with caramel malts, and grapes. The higher ABV provided a warming feeling that added to the experience. The ale has a medium body with soft carbonation. The finish was dry with no bitterness. Nice ale!!

Pours hazy copper with thin white head. Nose is cider and green apple. Aromas are green apple, orange, peach, caramel. Low carbonation, light body. Medium sour finish. Complex beer, buy not really my kind of stuff.

Clear, copper body with a small, off-white, fully lasting head. Complex and strong aroma of fruits, including slightly overripe peaches and mango, oak and hints of sourness. Strong flavour of grapefruit, peach and mango, with oak, caramel and funk in the back. Light sweet taste, light sourness and a quite biting bitterness. Medium body, very dry on the palate, lively carbonated. An unusual and complex brew! A fun mix of wild ale and IPA! 
[75 cl bottle, shared with Svensenga smak & behag, from cnesmarks beer cellar]
Pours a nice dark reddish amber color. Aromas of fruit, and some other hints, maybe some spices, maybe caramel. Flavor is a bittersweet, malty, and a hint of hops with a nice bittersweet finish.

Pours amber with small lasting head. aroma of tangy yeast, orange, white grapes, honey, caramel. tastes of candied fruits, caramel, barrel ageing comes right through, then a big hit of hops which i found too much. delicate white wine sourness and sweet fruits got fucked with the bitter hoppiness. disappointing..

On tap at The Bottle Shop Bermondsey. Cloudy amber colour lasting thin head. Nelson aroma of tropical fruit. Pretty intense. So what is this I mean its a bit like an abbey tripel in sweetness strength hoppy dry fruity. Candied tropical fruits. Big and intense for sure. Bitter dry tropical fruit finish. Pretty intense.

Tap at BrewDog Camden. Hazy orange shade with a white head. Aroma is juicy, pithy, fruity. Really dripping with hop juiciness. Notes of grapefruit, berries and orange peel. A tiny bit vegetal. Very good stuff.

20cl on-tap at Mikkeller & Friends, Nørrebro, Copenhagen (55 Danish Krone):
This one was a very nice beer from start to finish, I really enjoyed sipping away at it despite the fact it definitely did not seem like a 9% beer when I tried it; I guess a good balance will do that to beers. There was some light bitterness & a few floral hops alongside touches of grapefruit & plenty of grapes that made it a very easy beer to drink & one that seemed quite lively & fresh; definitely one that Id recommend you try if you get the chance.
Great floral aroma. The Nelson hops with the Brett is a perfect combination. Excellent balance of hop and bitter.

Tap. Rutland Arms, Sheffield. Hazy, pale Amber. Film of sticky, lasting, white head. Nose has fruity, orange hop. Some dried fruit. Bready, yeasty chew. Some lime tang. Nice level of brett. Has a vanilla sweetness. Taste is soft sweet. Some citric tang. Minimal bitterness. Lovely fruit. Clean palate at the ABV. Scarily easy drinking, in fact. Fruity, bretty, light bitter finish. Lovely beer.

Draught. Pours an oily cloudy orange with a thin lasting off white bubbly head. Aroma of apples, mandarins, white grapes, caramel. Taste is of caramel, citrus, oranges, hint of spice, bread, very sweet. Sticky oily mouthfeel, soft carbonation.

Où, Quand, Comment : 
Bouteille, dégustée le 6/25/2013. 


Visuel :  
Couleur : ambrée. 
Apparence : voilée. 


Arôme :  
Levures fruitées (agrumes), sauvages (brett) aux notes épicées, légèrement boisé (fût de chêne vineux), léger de houblon herbeux aux notes citriques. 


Goût :  
Entrée de bouche : Goût de levures fruitées, légèrement sauvages et aux notes épicées avec un léger goût boisé vineux. 
Un support houblonné herbeux aux notes citriques et florales est également bien présent avec quelques notes épicées et dalcool. 


En bouche :  

Corps : moyen.
Effervescence : moyenne.
Texture : légèrement huileuse.
Finale : moyenne et un peu sèche, composée dun goût légèrement amer de houblon herbeux aux notes citriques, ainsi que de levures fruitées avec quelques traces dalcool boisé.

Keg @ Tilt, Birmingham. Pours hazy amber, white head. Aroma is fruity, some citric orange and white wine. Taste is slightly resinous, some good fruity orange moments, not as complex as I imagined. Just a good hoppy DIPA. Perhaps in bottle this would be different.

Keg at Ushers. Hazy amber body with a thin white head. Lively carbonation. Faint lacing. Aroma of orange sherbet, funky yeast, white wine and lemon peel. Flavour of pineapple yoghurt, custard, salted bread, melon and subtle spices. Medium body with an oily mouthfeel. Soft fizz. Lovely balance of sweet and tart flavours.
Tasting at dvadve. Dark orange colour. Aroma of peach, yeasts, straw. Taste of citrus fruits, grapefruits, light bitterness, sweet aftertaste. Great one
Keg at The Bat. Hazyish amber. Nose is nelson sauvin, vinous, light wood, caranel and fruits. Taste is very sweet, caramel, hops, light booze, light vinous.

750 cc from Capones. Pours hazy, deep copper colored with splotchy, off-white head. Nose is fruity, champagne yeast, oaky, spicy, black peppery notes. Tastes dry, very fruity, with white grapes, melon, pear, florals, black pepper, oaky tannins, and hops. Super complex palate and finish. This one is delicious.

Mal wieder alles richtig gemacht. Endlich kann man als Bier und Weinliebhaber seinen beiden Gelüsten zusammen frönen und das alles in Bierform!!!! Perfekt!!! Die Beschreibung dieser Göttergabe lässt erahnen wie es schmecken könnte, wenn man es dann endlich trinken darf, werden alle kühnsten Erwartungen übertroffen. UNGLAUBLICH weinlastig und LECKER!!!! Vom Hahn bei Mikkeller & Friends in Kopenhagen 0,2l/9 Euro.

Hazy golden orange pour with a thin white head and thick bands of sticky lacing .... Aroma of sweet berries, grapes, vinous and sweet malts ..... Taste is of sweet berry like yeast, funky Brett, and vinous, has a bittersweet grape flavor ... Dry finish with fruity dry vinous notes .... Abv hidden well white wine is hidden beneath a sweet Berry flavor overall not bad at all

0.75l bottle as Nelson Sauvin. Hazy orange body with a very thin white head. Aroma of caramel, lemon zest, bubble gum, lichi, funkyness and some strawberry. Taste of caramel, bread, lemon zest, grape must, bubble gum and berries. Sweet, sour and bitter at the same time. Magnificent.

Fresh fruity hops and a slight belgian sourness. White wine is certainly dominant but theres still some fruity berry sweetness and mild hop bitterness. Dry white wine finish with some sticky hop resin. Really badass beer.

Lukt: Frisk, fruktig, plomme og stikkelsbær.
Utseende: Gyllen.
Skum/kullsyre: Lite skum.
Smak: Syrlig fruktig, lett drukket.

Drukket Som Alias@Mikkeller Nelson Sauvin Brut

Pours sparkling golden amber with orange touch. Small white head, very good lacing. Aroma is straw, lots and lots of brett, flowers, white wine, pear, apple, some nutmeg, some exotic fruit. Rather dry, medium to heavy bitter,medium to heavy sour, dry lingering beautiful finish. Very complex, beautifully balanced, excellent champagne-like qualities, alcohol is non-existent. Absolutely fantastic brew.

Pours a dark goldish color, not much of a head. Aroma is very bretty, some tropical fruit notes, light oak. Taste threw me off, I expected it to be more tart, but its actually quite rich, vinous, wine notes and some of the tropical fruit, mostly dried pineapple, good dry finish. Interesting and delicious.
grapefruit on the front end, pithy and ruby. Berry fruit aromas, acidic, vinous, herbal. Light medium body, creamy feel, fine white foam. Wow, this is delicious.

On tap. Amber brownish color, hazy liquid, white head. Aroma - cognac, oak barrels, cookies, bread, hops. Warm alcoholic finish. Medium to heavy bitter and sweet. Rich, complex, strong. Excellent for winter days.

dark golden to orange colour, medium sized off-white head; aroma of white wine, grape, floral-honey notes, some caramel, overripe fruits and hints of grapefruit; taste of white wine, yeast, fruitiness, fizzy, brut champagne notes, hints of honey and caramel, as well as earthy notes; dry mouthfeel; excellent Belgian strong ale

Copper-clear golden color with suds of head. Funky winey aroma. Dry and light; white-winey, honey, funky complex. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
750ml bottle. Hazy amber body with a medium head. Gooseberries, fruit, caramel. Dry finish.

Bue à la pression. Blonde ambrée, fine mousse blanche peu persistante. Nez fruité (fruits jaunes) et légèrement vineux. Au palais, peu de CO2, magnifiques corpulence et équilibre. Belle tenue, complexité maltée puis amère. Notes de mangue et dabricot. Finale longue et agréable. Top.

Pours a hazy brown body with a thin head. Super nice fruity aroma of hops. Rich and complex taste which is very well balanced. I am very happy that I fot my hands on one of these 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On draft 0,4l at Mikkeller, Copenhagen. Pours an copper with head that diminish. Aroma of tropical fruits, mango, papaya and some vinous white wine notes. Similar taste though much more vinous with clear sauvignon blanc characteristics. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap at c4. Pours light hazy amber with a White head. Aroma of alot Brett, grapes, fruity, light wood., mango. Taste is bretty, funk, tropical, light wood. Carbonation is medium. Dry wood finish.

From tap. Pours hazy amber with a white head. Aroma of brett and funk, pineapple, mango, super tropical. Taste is funky as f*uck, quite tropical, lots of pineapple, slightly tart, light wood in the finish, dry. Lovely.
750 ml bottle. Pours a cloudy Amber with light head. Aromas of Brett, old apples and sour fruit. Flavors of sour candied fruit, green grapes, Brett and other tropical hoppy stuff. Excellent.
This was pretty impressive. Sourness and wood undertones work together to make a very unique experience. Almost nebbiolo-like in aroma. Fantastic.

Backlog rating. 75cl bottle from Mother Kellys, London. it pours a rich dark golden / orange color with a large off-white head. Aroma is intense funk, white wine, apricots, lemon, tangerine, persimmon, fortified white wine, funk, barnyard, lychee. Unbelievably complex. Taste has more mix of winey, fruity, funky, grassy, citric, tangy notes. Medium to full bodied with soft to good carbonation. Overall, outstanding

Clear as a bell golden, visible carbonation and . Nose is rich, sticky bretty funk and a lean winey buzz. Initial taste is a firm sweetness, weirdly strawberry and a slick grapey wet sock dip. Carbonation is firm, clean enough but firm mouthfeel. Finishes sweetly bitter, long greasy brett and massively clean melon. Bottle, Beerhive, Decantillon Tasting
Bottle at Craigs. Non waxed. Pours clear gold with a thin write head. Aromas of brett funk, white wine. Taste is sherbet, funk, oak. Dry finish.
Bottle at craigs. Pours clear golden, nose is funky, fruity, light oak, taste is juicy fruit, dry, bretty.

Slightly cloudy, deep golden color, off-white head. Winy aroma with sweet, fruity notes. Taste follows with vanilla, fruit and butter. Full body, medium-low carbonation. 750ml from Systembolaget. Hazy amber, white fluffy and thick head leaving lacing. Aroma white wine, yeasty, white pepper. Medium carbonated, smooth and crisp mouthfeel. Taste got tart, red grape, yeast and oak. Lot of white wine taste.

750ml bottle for Premier Gourmet in Buffalo, New York. Orange-amber in colour, large off-white head, excellent lacing, excellent retention. Bottle, BB 16/10/22, so its almost 3 years old. Gushing a bit on opening but I was prepared for this to happen. Aroma has plenty of brett and some light fruity hoppiness, later hints of light white wine are added. Everything is subtle and not too assertive. Intressant öl, förhållandevis syrlig. Den påminner om vitt vin eller cider. Mer av sällskapsöl än matöl?

Botella 75 cl de 2d2dspuma tomada en el momento en llamas el 10-07-2015. (r444) con f de cons pref para antes de 16-10-2022. color ámbar anaranjado velado con espuma blanca. Aromas maltosos algo afrutados y ácidos con buenos toques de maderas. Sabores también ligeros maltosos afrutados ligeramente ácidos, sobretodo en frío, con una buena dosis de madera perfectamente integrada con una ligera acidez y amargo seco. Cuerpo medio de 9 vol con algo de gas algo pastoso pero fácil de beber en general. Increíble cerbeza para repetir sin duda.

July 1, 2015. Bottle. 
Hazy dark golden with a large frothy white head. Aroma is sweet fruity and vinous with peach, mango, lemon, grape, goose berries oak and some spicy yeast notes. Taste is sweet fruity up front with apricots, mango with an increasing white wine note long with some lemon juice. Finish is slightly tart lemon juice, dry white wine and oak notes and a light fruity sweetness. Medium bodied, average carbonation. Quite dry and very easy drinkable given its ABV.

750ml bottle leafft over since new years. Hazy dark golden with airy white head. Aroma of tropical fruits, mango, papaya and some vinous white wine notes. Similar taste though much more vinous with clear sauvignon blanc characteristics. Medium mouthfeel and minimal carbonation (though I remember it as more carbonated when fresher).

750ml bottle. Pours orange amber in colour with a frothy white foam head and aroma of fresh juicy citrus rind, floral notes, barnyard. Taste is sour, malt & grain in the background, against tangy orange citrus zest, fruity, flora notes, white white, woody oak, barnyard. Medium bodied, soft to medium carbonation, dry sour orangey woody finish. Very drinkable.
From a 75 cl bottle shared at home. Pours a hazy gold with an off white head. Aroma of white wine. Vinous flavors with some oak. Dry finish.
Tasted this beer both on tap and bottle and have to say that there are a great difference. You need to try it on tap

Draught at Mikkeller & Friends. Hazy, golden-amber colour with a thin, white head. Fruity aroma with citrus, yeasts, bretts, grape fruits, oak, vanilla and caramel malts. Taste is light sweet. Medium to full with a creamy texture and a lively carbonation. Finishes lasting dry and fruity with bretts and citrus fruits. Lovely classic from Mikkeller.

Wow, super complex aroma, a bit of Belgian yeast, a light Brett touch, and the wine barrels are all clear. Very drinkable, the time in the wine casks gives a great dry finish, very difficult to detect the 9% abv. Fantastic .

[4/27/15] Draught at Mikkeller Bar in Copenhagen. Clear golden. Nice fruity hops aroma with a bit of yeast and a bit of alcohol. Flavor of fruity hops, yeasty spiciness, and a bit of alcohol. Medium-bodied.

Pours hazy orange with a thick white head. Aromas lots of fruit, apricots, mango, citrus, gooseberries, vinous notes, brett and some woody dry notes. Taste is as the nose, lots of fruit, citrus, mango, light hops, dry wood and gooseberries. The brettanomyces are very present. Lovely.

Pours a deep golden color with a big head and good lace. 
The aroma is fruity with plenty of lemon and melon, its lightly funky & very inviting. 

The flavor tickles my fancy just so, a tart citrus akin to meyer lemons & muskmelon along with a mild bitterness, a very pleasant dry character and a light bit of sour fruit. The alcohol is masterfully concealed and th shop character is dominant but perfectly inter-woven. 

Wonderful really,

750ml c&c bottle from SHIG, I think. Poured an orange/amber body under a large fizzy off-white head. Aroma/flavor, funky, rotting fruit, earth, lemongrass, vinous. Flavor also has some cherry, chardonnay and wet wood. Full body from stronger carbonation that is fizzy and a medium mouthfeel with a nice lingering aftertaste.
Intenso aroma, ácido, igual que su sabor. Su maduración en barrica de vino le confiere un sabor ácido único, difícil de conseguir y que salga una buena cerveza.

Först aprikos-/persikodoft, sedan kraftig kattpiss.
Tendens till disighet. Vackert bärnstens färgad med dragning mot rött.
Smakrik, halm, malt och aning vinjästig smak med saftigt mogen stenfrukt.
Fyllig och rund smak med perfekt kolsyra. 
Vinös ananas i den halvtorra eftersmaken.
Loads of grapefruit on the front end, pithy and ruby. Berry fruit aromas, acidic, vinous, herbal. Light medium body, creamy feel, fine white foam. Wow, this is delicious. Thank you Andy.

Bottle. somewhat of a gusher on opening. Pours clear reddish amber with a large white head that mostly dissipates leaving a lot of residual and good lacing. Aroma is initially quite funky, barnyard and horse blanket. After it breathes out some oaky and vinous notes, some fruitiness, passionfruit almost. Flavor is very light sweet, dry indeed, just a light tartness to go with medium funk, medium bitterness and a ton of vinous and oaky notes. There is a tropical note to it as well, presumably from the Nelson hops, although my bottle, being from 2013, has likely seen most of the specific hop character fade with time. There is a certain heat in the finish due to the 9% ABV.

Ambré. Collet blanc. Nez: fruité. Caramel. Pomme verte. Vin blanc. Levure sauvage. Boisé. Bouche : sûre. Belle effervescence. Boisé. Vin blanc fortifié. Fine chaleur d'alcool. Herbacé. Fruit exotique. Litchi. Gingembre. Astringente. Finale boisé sèche et épicé. Excellente.
Not my kind of beer, but a is a must, a candy for a child. Strong peach and grape notes, well balanced, with some grassy notes.

Hazy appearance (surprise, surprise) and a peachy amber colour and an aroma that suggests unripe peachy fruitiness. Fulsome in the mouth with a good dash of sweetness, apricots, white peaches and a little bit of tang. It was much cleaner than I expected and dangerously easy to drink. There was a whole lot to like and a lot more depth that I was expecting. Lovely stuff.

Tap at Mikkeller Bar, Stockholm, 16th March 15. Aroma vinous, the Brett sourness come through. The taste is clean and well balanced, loved the Brett, citrus too. Want this again

Shared Bottle. Amber color with thick white head. First aroma kick is full of Nelson Sauvin hops, than it follows with herbal, fresh, citrusy, almost champagne like/wine aromas. Enjoyable beer, I would try it again when possible for sure.

75 cl bottle, generously shared by Peter.
Amber with a small creamy, thick head. 
Aroma has a lot of Nelson hops at first, followed by a lot of freshness, citrus and lemon, some tartness as well.
Taste has once again, loads of Nelson hops and is in addition to that peppery, spicy, woody, has white wine notes and light herbal bitterness.
Light to medium body, spritzy carbonation and dry mouth feel.
Dry white wine like after taste, slight alcohol as well.
A pricey beer but shared on 3, its well worth it. Refreshing and really tasty!

Bottle at home from Cotteridge Wines (£24)
Lightly hazy burnished gold with rich gooseberry, slightly funky with esters, moderate carbonation, full bodied, fruity full on nelson sauvignon flavour, catty, dank gooseberry, citrus perfume, rich yeast esters, warming and pithy bitterness with a long winey finish. Excellent
Hazy golden orange pour with a white head. Grape, Brett, some funk, and light fruit. Delicious! One of mikkellers best
Bottle as Nelson Sauvin Brut. Orange golden color with medium white head. Tart, vinous aroma with hops. Tart vinous taste with gooseberries, fruity sweetness, wood. Very tasty beer.

Bottle. Aroma very intense, fruity, maracuja, grapes, very fresh, very inviting. Clear golden colour. Taste nasterfully combines three elements - exotic maracuja hoppiness, subtle white wine barrels and bubblegum bretty funk. Top league.

Tap at Mikkeller Viktoriagade. Pours clear orange amber, small head. Aroma is insane tropical fruit and Sauternes, with mango, dank lychee, Brett, durian, peach, honey, and faint pine. Taste is fruit and honey at first with some dry Orval-like character through the middle and then finish of pineapple and sweet white wine. Syrupy but with some effervescence, and alcohol is well hidden. Impressive.

75cl bottle. Pours an orange amber with a big frothy white head. Aroma: Wow! this smells crazy good! Exotic peach, mandarin, grapes, galia-melon, funk, dry brett, pomelo, hops, papaya, passionfruit. Man this is a fruity fellah! Taste is fruity sweet at first, but turns dry with bitter brett, funky fruity tartness, pepper, wine grape sourness. So much taste, Lovely body as well! Well done!!

Tasted on 11/11/11 from a capped 750mL bottle with Ryan. Pours cloudy burnt orange with a very thick beige head that slowly recedes to rocky lace. The nose is very fruity and vinous with tons of grapefruit, funky barnyard brett, and just a touch of caramelized malt. The flavor is a bit more caramelized and bitter than the nose, with the fresh grapefruit, vinous notes, and barnyard brett funk all nicely balanced. The body is medium with an oily texture, average but very smooth carbonation, and a long bitter grapefruit and brett funk finish.
750 ml. bottle. Thanks Nikos! Pours a cloudy golden orange with a very nice white head. Aroma of fruit, yeast, malt, and wood. Taste is grapes, citrus, yeast, malt, and barrel. Very good!
Fantastisk arom. Frisk, saison aktig, hel del citrus. Smaken balanserad, humlig, citrus.

Färsk fruktig arom, ljus till färgen med vitt skum. Mycket söt men inte sliskig, en fruktig sötma med en försiktig beska. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a deep orange with a huge white head. Aroma is brett, barnyard funk and slight coriander. Taste is apricot sweet initially followed by a lemon tartness, slightly mild sour yeasty bacteria and a bit of coriander. Quite carbonated and medium bodied.
Bottled:Hazy, pale brown with a lively head.Aroma is white wine, lemons, lime, grape fruit and grass.Refreshing taste of lemons, lime and dry, white wine.Damn good beer!

A M A Z I N G !!!
Wow - Im stunned... And Im in love...

Golden amber , a little hazy, beer with a three finger hig head (white).

Nose: Green apples, gooseberry, pears, grass, orange, marmelade, yeast, grapes, white wine, roobarb, oak, vanilla, honey, spices, herbs.... This NEVER ends! Is so complex!
Taste: Lime, orange, green apples, tart, tropical fruits, oak barrel... THIS is love!
Body: Full body with a crisp carbonation. A fresh, bitter and dry ending. 

Im knocked out! This is so good! I just hate myself not not buying more bottles...

Vinous, aromatic, noticable hoppiness and funky yeastiness, really reminiscent of a more earthy, funky sauvignon blanc. ABV evident, but well integrated.
Amber colour, medium white head, lacing.
Funky tart, yeasty and noticable hoppy, very vinous, medium bite, mid-sweet, lightly umami, noticable yeastiness, complex.
Medium body, soft carbonation, acidic, warming and yeasty hoppy aromatic finish.
Solid.

Bottle. Pours hazy orange with a thick white head. Aromas lots of fruit, apricots, mango, mandarin, orange, citrus, vinous notes, brett, some woody dry notes, some spices. Taste is as the node, lots of fruit, orange, citrus, unripe apricots, mango, mandarin, some spices, light hops. Reminds me of a bretty saison. In a perfect way.

(750ml bottle from Systembolaget - New Years Eve 2014 beer!) Pours a crystal clear medium copper with a big bubbly frothy white head that lingers well, with a wall of lace. Aroma beautifully vinous, driven by a core of white grape with cantaloupe and orange peel. Lots of funky, barnyardy and softly cheesy Brett, leather from oak, with hints of vanilla, lemon acidity and grass. Palate sweet and fruity at first with lots of white wine grape, peach, apricot, tangerine and some more exotic citrus, think I am missing something tropical. Moderate malt with slightly bready quality. White wine acidity builds from the middle on, Brett barnyard, a good amount of oak with vanilla. The latter two are dominant in the dry, bitter finish along with herbal, slightly spicy hops. Mouthfeel is medium full, creamy effervescent carb, perfect really. No booze heat. Phenomenal beer from Mikkeller, right up with their best stouts. There is so much going on here in all taste types. Super drinkable. Perhaps appeals to wine lovers most but the Belgian and funky sides are top notch as well. Cant say enough good things really.

#1 of 2015. 0,75L bottle (aged more than a year), BB 16.10.22. Pours amber-orange with beige head. The head stays for some time. Aroma is sweet and sour, fruits, apricot, citric, grapes, floral notes, vinous notes, some grass. Flavor is sweet, tropical fruits, apricot, citrus, grapes, white wine, some alcohol and some spices. Finish is fruits, white wine and some dryness. Overall: I had a fresher bottle some time ago and I actually enjoyed it even more when hops where stronger. Still a great brew to start a new beer year.

31-DEC-2014, bottle @New Years Eve, 4 years in my cellar, will it hold up?
Hazy amber with lasting, creamy off-white head of small bubbles that lasts and laces. Aroma is wonderfull tart with lots of brett and White wine.
Taste is malt, brett, White wine, cherry, wett horseblanket. Full body, dry - very dry, tart. Sooooou long after taste of brett. Any Nelson Sauvin left? Yes, perhaps a Little cats pee.
This is really World class. Just what I hoped for:-)

750 ml bottle split two ways. Hazy dark golden pour with some head. Wow, the nose on this on is out of this world! Loads of grapes, some tartness, lemon juice, green apples and some peaches as well. Taste follows the nose pretty much spot on with the addition of some bretty bitterness and some sweet vanilla notes. Super dry finish. Very good!

750 mL bottle courtesy of Yarema, served in a stem glass. Pours slightly hazy orange-amber with a small off-white head that fades to a thin cover and leaves a moderate amount of fine lace. The nose has huge white wine and oak notes, along with apple and tart fruit, pale malts and Belgian yeast. The flavour is moderately sweet, with apple, peach, apricot, white wine, oak, pale malts, earth and Belgian yeast notes. Tart Brett notes are present throughout with plenty of citrus peel. A subtle resinous hoppy bitterness picks up through the middle and lingers through a long and winey-oaky finish with huge orange and grapefruit peel bitterness and nice barnyard notes. On the palate it is light-medium in body with a smooth, watery texture. Overall, a very nice wine-barrel aged Belgian ale with huge barrel notes. Incredibly complex, with much of this coming from the barrel. 2015-01-02

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines. Some things: i) I was frightened to drink this, lest it didnt live up to expectation.................... it did; ii) lovely flavour of white wine, Nelson Sauvin hops; iii) lovely sourness - not overtly funky, but crisply tart, with equality of sweetness and sourness; iv) THIS IS OUTSTANDING; v) does not drink like 9% - seems more like 5%, which makes this incredible sinkable and lethal; vi) Wow, just wow.
Kopparfärgad med stort vit skum. Doftar och smakar tropisk humle och lite vildjäst och vitvin. Perfekt nyårsöl!! Mycket humle!
Flaska från SB. Kopparfärgad med luftigt vitt skum. Syrlig doft av vin och kryddig humle. Syrlig funkig smak.

Tydlig brett doft. Citrus. Extremt kolsyrad. Som en skumpa. Påminner verkligen om en mousserande. Torr och porlande. Kolsyrad gösser i smaken. Inte så mycket smak. Blir spännande att prova om ett par år. Men räcker med ett glas. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bärnstensfärgad kropp. Frisk doft av jästa äpplen och vitt vin. Mkt frisk smak. Belgisk jäst, vingummi, calvados och en oljig touch av Nelson Sauvignon. Gillar verkligen den här ölen.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; hazy amber pour with a frothy off white head, funk and fruit aroma, taste has tart lemon, barnyard funk, melon, peach, there a lot going on, brett, some wood, excellent stuff.
hay, citrus, earthy, woody, pale, clear, frothy, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium sourness, full body, oily feel, average carbonation, long finish,

Bottle, a nice one. Pours hazy orange with big frothy foamy off-white head, sparkling. Aroma has tons of grapes! Funky brett, dry wood, slight leather oaky vanilla, really complex and delicate. Sweet peach candy, pomelo, acidic passion fruit. Taste is sweet juicy apricots. Slight bready malts, vanilla, tart apples, oak, acidic white wine. Finish has dry wood and delicious white pepper. Body is so damn delicious, fizzy and creamy. No alcohol at all. This beer is extremely balanced and complex in a very delicate way.
Beer tasting @ Havregatan 21/12-14. Bottle from Systembolaget. Aroma: Bretty, fruity, grape, light acidic. Taste: Dito. Body is medium, the finish is dry, fruity and bretty.

@ Havregatan 141221. Bottle (750 ml) from Systembolaget. Fruity and bretty with some light sourish notes, crisp, grapefruits, sweet, medium body with a watery to oily texture. The finish is dry, bitter and bretty.

Bottle 2014 edition. Hazy orange, big frothy white head. Beautiful! Packed with grapes, subtle funky leather, flowery brett and dry white wine notes with peach and mandarin, orange and melon. It really is amazingly complex, delicate and subtle. Taste is also packed with bretty and grapy goodness, very dry and loaded with fruits and berries, almost perfect balance, nothing seems misplaced. The body and carbonation are really well aligned.

Bottle. 

Pours hazy Albert.

Aroma is slightly grape/orange, lots of grapes and the funky sour notes.

Medium bodied, lots of vanilla, fresh melon and peach, dry white wine and grapes. Very exotic and smooth!

750 ml bottle. Hazy orange with big frothy white head. Smell is earthy, orange, citrus zest, and funky stables. Taste is vinous (white wine), citrus, vanilla oak barrel and funky stables, leaves and earthy. Very dry with medium bitterness and high carbonation.
One of my favs. From mikkeller. Terrific wild ale with winie notes. Well balance ans complex

Flaska 75 cl systembolaget. Orangebrun kulör med stort fluffigt skum. Fuktig doft av apelsin, citron, druvor, halm och funk. Komplex smak med funkkänsla. Stall, hö och jordkällare. Citrus, vitt vin och fat. Härlig syrlighet och fint krispigt torr. Mycket kolsyra och alkoholstyrkan döljs väl.

Bottle; at home; courtesy of madmitch76 (the legend). 750ml bottle. Vigorous pour into my IPA glass-of-choice. A nice head. Lovely head. Ruby-ish dark appearance. Very murky. Opaque. 

Aroma is; oak; woodchips; brett; musty wood; grapes; Nelson and a lot of bready yeast. I think it is slightly oxidised but that is not a problem as it is heavy with brett. Very damp wet grass aroma as well. 

Taste is orange tart; citric juice. Scilian lemons. grapefruit; white grapes; Finnish rye bread; farmhouse funk and sour and tart overtones. The brett works wonders with Nelson and really dances off my tongue. Its well-carbonated and definitely a sipper. Alcohol is also prominent but not ott. There is a good amount of balance for such a complicated beer. 

The drinkability is what surprises me the most about this beer. It is definitely a nod to Orval levels of thirst-quenching despite its relatively high abv. I would like to see different barrels on this one as it is an incredibly good beer. Superb work Mikkel!
Aroma of grape fruit, citrus & orange. Clear amber with long lasting head. Lightly bitter with a sweet touch. Medium body, slick texture & average carbonation.

Bottle: Dark brown, ruddy copper body with a thin, bubbly, khaki colored film on top. Aroma is very wine-like & vinous. White & red grape with notes of darker fruits, plums, prunes & a light tartness with a hint of booze behind everything. Flavor is a bit nutty & almost toasty, although still very vinous & wine forward. Slightly warming booze, earthy hop notes, red licorice, mild woody elements towards the finish with a little bit of semi-spicy Belgian yeast making for a mostly clean finish. Bubbly mouth feel, aftertaste of dark fruit & faint red wine. Good, but I didnt love it like I thought I would.
"what a great beer! hoppy, fruity, oak, white wine grapes, and a little funk all come through in about equal measure. Each sip was a delight. Lively body and a nice dry finish."

[5732-20130823] 1pt9.4floz bottle. Light white wine notes and fruity yeast in the aroma. Clear, orange body with a long-lasting creamy off-white head. Sweet toasted grape skins flavour has a tart aftertaste. Medium body. Delicious. (8/4/8/4/17) 4.1
(w/ blankboy, jercraigs, Radek Kliber, Colin)

Bottle from Alen. Dark amber with a creamy beige head. Light tartness and maltiness that reminds me slightly of a flanders red, smooth, zinfindel, oak, oak, apple, light peach. Moderate carbonation and body, tangy, hint of citrus on the palate, slightly sweet but more tangy, bit dry, quite enjoyable.

Nariz: El conjunto aromático es complejo con notas de malta tostada, toffe, vainilla , levadura y brett, uva, madera, recuerda a vino blanco 

Boca, una cerveza sedosa, en boca se percibe algo de acidez y se acentúa la presencia de la brett y la levadura ligera sensación cremosa y un final ligeramente seco 

Vista turbia , Cobriza con tonos rojizos y oro viejo, corona densa con una micro espuma fina y compacta color beige

Pours a lightly hazy dark copper with a huge frothy off white head. Aroma of brett, funk, white wine, wood and light spicy pepper. Taste is wood, white wine, oak, light funkiness, fruity and some alcohol warmth on the finish. Finishes really dry as well which makes this a complex beauty... Pleasure to drink!

Pours a hazy amber-copper with an average sized white head and good legs. Aroma is brettanomyces, white wine, oak, and mild fruity notes. Flavour is brettanomyces, white wine, oak, faint alcohol, fruity, and a pretty dry finish. Definitely a fan!
Klar lys gyllen farve med lyst skum. Lukt av grapefrukt og sitrus. Smak av grapefrukt, furunål og sitrus. Fruktig. Tap @ Melkebaren.

					It smells fruity and funky, with a dominate aroma of pears and apples present. That is mixed with some lemon zest, a clear brett presence, and some notion that this was aged in sauvignon blanc barrels, for sure.					
					
					
					
					The taste is complex, to say the least. I get a lot of citrus (grapefruit and lemon especially), some funk, a touch of wood as though the barrel itself is asserting itself, and a sharp acidic bite in the middle of the palate.					
					
					
					
					It finishes fairly clean and leaves a bit of that sharp tang on the tongue, along with the memory of pears and apples. 					
					
					
					
					The drinkability is fairly high, with the effervescence lending some help there. The funk lowers it out of the highly drinkable range, but it isnt enough of a serious detractor to lower it beyond a 4.

A soft pour into my Teku glass produces a pale tan colored head that starts out two-fingers in height and leaves some nice lacing on the sides of the glass. The beer is a concentrated amber color that shows an absolutely gorgeous, bright, shining, brilliantly clear, amber hue when held up to the light. The nose, as expected, smells of tropical fruit and Brettanomyces funk; grassy, tropical, funky, mango, guava, peach syrup, funky tropical fruit notes that are quite floral. I really like how hoppy the nose is; lightly herbal and woody, but lots of bright, funky fruit character. As the beer warms up, nutty, spicy, woody oak notes round out the aroma.

Lightly sweet tasting, which is accentuated by the tropical fruit notes, but the finish is dry and funky with phenolic Brettanomyces notes that lean towards medicinal notes, definitely a bit musky, and perhaps a touch of plastic character. The beer is quite effervescent, this works well with the Brettanomyces flavors, and the lightly viscous body that makes this beer quite quaffable. The hop character contributes flavors of tropical fruit, lychee, guava, mango, lots of floral peach, kumquat marmalade, and Meyer lemon. The malt character here is quite light in relation to the other notes, but still does contribute flavors of English biscuit, hints of whole grain cracker, and a touch of caramelized malt character that is here just enough to support the vibrant hop character. The wood character plays a supporting role, it contributes soft notes of vanillin, a definite biting, spicy edge to the hop character and a finish that has some woodiness to it; this is only just so though, as the wood character is really quite restrained and works really well to support the hop and Brett character.

This is a quite good beer; the mix of bright, funky, fruity hops, and funky Brettanomyces character hits my funky / hoppy spot quite well. The hop character and the Brett achieve a really nice balance here; I am not sure of the age of this bottle, but the hops are still quite vibrant, and they balance very well with the Brett character at this moment in time. Somehow this is almost a guilty pleasure, certainly simple in its focus between hop and Brett, but this really is a mix of flavors that really appeal to me at this moment in time. This beer just keeps getting better and better with each pour, this is the first Brut beer that I have had that has actually been clear from the first pour to the last, and this is certainly the best Champagne style beer that I have had to date.
