Nose of acid, catpiss, grapefruit, mandarine orange, durian, manure, wood. Strange and fascinating. Bright, glowing orange color with lace. Slightly sour, funky flavor, grapefruit and mandarine, sweet biscuits, grape, pomegranate. Rich fruity sweetness makes a good contrast to the funk. Great.

Tap in the Mikkeller Bar. Poured a slightly hazy medium amber with a frothy white head. The aroma is rich citrus, but a little week. The flavour is kinda bitter sweet and sour with the sweetness winning overall. There is oak and white wine plus plenty of other things going on.  Im not sure what I really think of this beer. I should order another to be sure.

Sample at mikkellers. 
Thin creamy white head.   clear amber pour.  complex aftertaste.

Draft at Mikkeller.  Pours clear amber with an off white head.  Aroma of brett, barnyard, horse blanket, white wine, citrus, light fruits, caramel.  Flavour is moderate sweet and acidic.  Full bodied with soft carbonation.

Clear golden orange, medium creamy off-white head. Nose has a ton of citric fruitiness and some funk, some yeast. Taste is peaches, grapefruit, leathery vinous  acidic notes, caramel, alcohol. Hops and crisp dryness in the finish. Medium body, smooth carbonation, slightly oily mouthfeel. Fantastic.

Bottle shared at CBC Clerkenwell, London during the Birthday Celebration of Jack & Leighton - big thanks to Tom! Pours clear, deep gold with a fine, creamy cap. Nose rife with grapefruit, melon, funk, pee and tangerine. Big sweet flavor with some cutting brett funk, light earth, lots of ripe citrus. Full bodied with average carbonation. Lightly warming finish with mango, melon and grapefruit. Solid.

Bottle poured a magnificent transluscent golden orange with a large foamy white head and notable lacing. Aroma includes kiwi, guava, pepper, and Brett funk. Taste begins with citrus and tropical fruits followed by a subtle wave of Brett and some spice leading to berries on a clean crisp finish. Champagne like effervesence with flavors lingering long after each sip.
Smak och doft av fläder, passionsfrukt, humle, citrus. Fantastisk doft, syrlig och söt. Beskan tar ner intrycket. Sträv beska med smak av rabarber och grapefrukt.
Very cloudy light amber colur; aroma is spicy; wine is quite noticeable in the flavour, almost no bitter, some sweet notes, and a very slight dryness. Brett yeast is quite nuanced.

Pours a cloudy dark orange brew with a big white head with regular retention, aroma is moderate sweet and moderate acidic with notes of sour fruits, citrics, bret and caramel, médium bodied, favor is moderate sweet, moderste bitter and moderate acidic with notes of sour fruits, bret, citrics and caramel, bittersweet and acidic finish, complex.

Pours cloudy brown. Lots of brett but very well balanced and palatable. Nice lacing and head. Finsihes trademark sour and bitter. Nelson hops comes in great here for awesome mix. No single taste stands out here because its so well-balanced. Tasting at volos thanks to Americo.

Bottle sampling at Bar Volo. A malt liquor with lots of fruitiness. Good drinkability. Peachy coloured body with a little head and lace. A big bold taste, full mouthfeel. Sour fruit aroma. A worthwhile big beer to try.

Bottle from the generous Black IPA.  Pours a clear amber color with a soapy white head and active carbonation.  Aroma is citrusy hops and loads of eartiness.  Taste is sweet with some candied sugar, vinous notes and strong earthy notes.  Medium bodied and dry.  Alcohol is well hidden.  Good stuff.

Bottle.  Pours dark, cloudy amber with thick, frothy off-white head; good retention and some lacing.  Aroma is cookie and cereal malt, spicy and floral hops, figs, belgian yeast, grapes, and light oak.  Flavor is white wine, sweet malts, floral hops (light bitterness), and dark fruit esters; dry finish with a touch of oak.  Medium body and carbonation.

Bottle.  Pours mostly clear amber with a medium, frothy white head, short retention with excellent lacing.  Aroma is farmhouse Brettanomyces, citrus, floral, and spicy hops, mango and passion fruit esters with grape must, oak, and biscuit and cookie malt.  Flavor is vinous, oak, and farmhouse Bretty notes with sweet malt, medium hops and bitterness with a dry finish.  Medium-full body and medium carbonation.

Pours a hazy golden orange color with three fingers of sticky eggshell foam. The nose is very vinous with lots of barrel character, brett, grass, pine. On the palate its a lot of the same with nice complexity. Ripe grapefruit, touch of acidity, fresh grass, honeyed malts and a bit of horse blanket funk to round out the palate. Nice beer.

Burnt orange. 3 finger head
Bretty and orange on the nose 
Very grape skin after taste of cloves and citrus. Very grapefruity with honey. Very grassy
Big bottle. Aroma of dark malts, complex woody flavors. The major taste experience here is the dryness and bitterness reminding of grape peels.
Bottle. Hazy orange color, tiny off-white head. Caramel, hops, fruity and vinegary notes in aroma. Sweet, vinegar, citrus, orange in flavor. Soft carbonation.

UPDATED: APR 29, 2017 Cloudy orange with thin off white head. Lacing OK.
Aroma.. citrus hoppy, fruity malty, sweet honey like.
Sweet with dry sour finish. Quite high carbonation.
Interesting beer, nice quality, thou bit too high sourness

Bottled. A hazy amber beer with a thin beige head. The aroma has notes of wood, bettanomyces, malt, caramel, grapes, and barnyard. The flavor is sweet with funky notes of brettanomyces, malt, wood, grapes, caramel, alcohol, and barnyard, leading to a dry finish.

One of the more finer beers that I have ever sampled. Good vinegary aroma, some barn, dust and big apple profile. Coppar with a small head, almost like Orval looking. Taste is all brett, vinegar, oak, hops. Fantastic palate. Long finish. Awesome brew!

UPDATED: MAR 7, 2015 750 bottle in a snifter.  Pours golden with a lacy head.  Aroma of the wine, some floral and lightly citrus hops, and caramel malts.  Flavor the same.  Average texture.  A good beer for the style.   Bottle purchased at HF in 2015.  Tastes better than I remember.

Sample at Jungle Jims Barrel Aged Tasting, from a bottle. Clear golden orange color. Little white head. Decent lace. Nice citrusy brett nose. Good soft carbonation. Medium body. More dry texture, light belgian funk. Citrus hops. Good zesty, sweet taste. Hint of baked apple. Very tasty.

A - Hazy orange-copper with a finger of frothy off-white head. Fades normal.

S - Grapefruit, tropical, pine, and lightly spicy hops, sweet caramel and bready malts, oak, white wine, vanilla, a bit of sourness, and a bit of booze.

T - Grapefruit, tropical, citrus, pine, and spicy hops, bitterness, sweet caramel and bready malts, oak, white wine, some sourness and a bit of funk, champagne yeast, a bit of vanilla, and a bit of booze.

M - Medium-full bodied with moderate carbonation. Smooth with a dry, bitter, tart, and warming finish.

D - Excellent balance. The hops and the barrel character blend very well.

Bottle @ home...It pours hazy orange with a large fluffy creamy off white head...... The aroma is fruits, sour, bitter, citrus, caramel, white grapes and brett..... The flavor is so nice it is almost perfect! imo... :) very vinous, fruity, berries, brett, peach, light spices, caramel and sour....with a finish that is very nice! dry and light acidic.....Hope to have this fantastic brew again!

UPDATED: JAN 21, 2013 Bottle @ Il pretesto. It pours golden orange with a tiny white head on top. Very fruity with orange hints... and then there it is the sour! But never covering the global complexity. A great beer!!
Great fruity aroma. Slightly sour and fruity taste. A great replacement for champagne.

Bottle (750 ml). Hazy orange with a huge creamy/foamy mostly lasting off-white head and intense lacing. Aroma is winey with brettanomyces, wood, grape, fruits, belgian yeast and hops. Taste is also winey with fruits, brett, grapes, wood, malt and slight sourness. Slight bitterness. Mouthfeel is smooth and  winey. Alcohol is completely hidden. This beer is fresh, complex, drinkable and truly enjoyable! Awesome beer!

Ridiculous beer. As in ridiculously good. Pours like a champagne, but is a burnt orange colour. Rapidly dimishing head. Bready, sour, sweet aroma. Taste is nelson, then sour, then sweet grape. Is this a beer?
Finish is bitter sweet.
Ive had nothing like this before. Could almost be a dessert wine. Im not a fan of Austrian or German wines, but this is just spot on. Would live them to do the same beer, but with dry New Zealand barrels.
Totally out there.
@ S.Brevinga Alus Salons. Very interesting beer. First, pleasant aroma of Nelson Sauvin, but you cant feel a lot of hops in taste as well as 9ABV of alcohol, nice sourness and wine notes.

Bottle shared by Thorpe429. Thanks Mike.

The beer is a honey orange color and has a thick, fizzy white head. Lasting retention and the tulip glass is coated with lacing. The aroma brings floral and vegetable notes, reminiscent of Cantillon Mamouche. Green peppers, plants, very vegetal. Medium bodied with plenty of carbonation. Hops emerge in the finish. Complex and intriguing, this is enjoyable in small quantities.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 01-01-2012
Bottle @ NK. Hazy orange colour with a long lasting off-white head that leaves a heavy lacing. Aroma of grapefruit, caramel. Flavour is dry fruit, grapefruit, malt.
Sample at ÖÖWF 2012. Sweet and fruity smell with white wine, hops and gooseberries. Similar taste. Light sourness that balances out with the sweetness. Interesting beer.

Draft, 2012 ed. Pour is clear amber and with small white sparkling head. Aroma is ripe pear, apricot, caramel, grapes, some fresh plum, toffee and some wood. 
Taste: Zesty and complex fruitynes, wood, brettm - nice residual sweetness. Medium body, ends slightly dry and crips - very elegant.

Clear amber with a small white head. Aroma has notes of elderflower, caramel, grapes, green apples, pear. Taste is light tropical fruits, pear, white grapes, brett. Light soft mouthfeel with prickly carbonation. Light and dry finish. Very elegant. I feel classy drinking this even though I'm lying in the gutter.
this ones a treat! great fruty citrusy aroma, again in flavour with more bitterness and bret sourness. lovely.

750 ml. Hazy copper with a most annoying five inch head. Aroma is sour leather, vinegar, blackberry, and earthy honey. Taste is flowery honey, sour grapes, oak and toffee. Long finish has some wheat and bubblegum. Medium body is smoothly carbonated and well balanced. Well crafted, as always from Mikkeller, very smooth and nicely sweet and sour.

Flaska från Brill. En öl som är extra allt på ont och gott. Brunorange med stort skum.Doft av vitt vin, krusbär och rabarber. Rejäl kropp, syrlig brett, strävbesk humle, rejäl beska, torr, sötsyrlig. Maffig men lite spretig som ändå lyckas balansera på rätt sida utan att bli för mycket.

Bottle kindly shared by the die by the beer boys @ @ Henrik, Bergen. Hazy amber body with much carbonation and a collapsing off-white head. Aroma is vinous and slightly sour with citric fruity hops. Flavor is light malty, citric fruity, some grapefruit and distinct Nelson hops, decent bitterness. Nice body and a fine aftertaste with fruit and  bitterness that ends quite dry. Nice and refreshing with a subtil complexity.

750ml botte - aged about a yesr.  Pours murky amber color.  Tastes like a darker ba saison.  Theres a fair amiunt of sweetness, a nice orange marmalade with a citrus tang - a little funk but def no sour The wine barrel character is present and integrated nicely.  Really liked this one a lot.

Copper amber with a good white head, fading. Nice fruity-oaky aromas typical of wine barrel-aged beer with hints of bretts. Chewy palate, fruity with a zesty note, a bit of leather fromthe brett, prickly carbonated, but finishing on the sweet side. Overall, not bad, aromas are great but the palate is way too sweet for my liking and making it everything but quaffable.
Bottle. Frothy white fair mostly deminishing head. Yellow colour. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma. Moderate bitter flavor. White wine barrel nicely present. Long moderate bitter finish. Creamy palate.

Amber coloured beer, didnt see while shopping that it contained Brett. Which is not my thing, but giving it a try. Amber body with a ok head. The brett and sourness are in the smell, but not to overwhelming. At the taste some more.
Bottle. Medium head with good duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are yeast, fruits, citrus, caramel, malt and hops.

A-- Poured a dark, golden, hazy, straw color. Solid looking one finger head. Recedes pretty quickly and leaves a lot of soapy foam on the sides of the glass. Good head retention to this. Swirling gets two fingers of head, off white or white brown, and recedes pretty quickly again.

S-- Interesting nose. Vinegar, lemon, funk, bread. Sure this is not a sour??

T-- White wine, lemon, vinegar, toasted bread, Peach, Carmel. How very different. 

M-- Brett adds a very different quality to this. Just a little bit of pucker but some lemon and peach fruitiness to this. Also get the wine barrel at the end and finishes quite dry and crisp with a touch of sourness. 

D-- Good because it is different
Bottle. Dark rddish brown with a small fluffy white head. Caramel apple pear and lemon aroma and taste with a tart Brett fruitiness and bready notes throughout. Nice silky lively palate. Very good.
Hazy light amber color with ivory sheen. Bready malt, earthy barnyard, wine barrel aromas. medium body. Tart white wine flavors with wet wood bugs, spicy yeast, citrus fruits--good
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text:
@Basunen: doften är mycket torr med tydligen vitvins fat. Smaken är lätt syrlig med en trevlig frisk underton. Ganska torr men med tydliga druvinslag. Mycket gott. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, 75cl corked. An unclear, golden-orange beer with a minimal sized, off-white head. Citrus peel, maltyness and a whiff of orange in the aroma. A light touch of brett and ripe fruits too. Bitter flavor with some malty sweetness, with the brett evident but far from pushing. Medium to full body, pleasant carbonation. Nice bitterness in the finish. Maybe I had too high expectations. Its a nice beer, thats for sure, but I was hoping for more intense flavors and aromas. Not dissatisfied though, not at all. 111209

Bottle shared at Mikkeller Bar, july 18th 2012.
Cloudy amber colored body, white head. 
Aroma of vanilla, grapes, brett, citric hops. Taste of wood, grapefruit, peach, funky yeast notes, herbs. Really nice bitterness and a good balanced beer overall

Appearance: pours dark coppers with orange highlights  a visage of Fall foliage. Head fades clumpy, patchy, lacy, and bold. Swirls without lace but puffs up nicely.

Nose: grape musk rusticity of the barrels the beer was aged in. Rows of Sauvignon Blanc orchards basking in the sun while the earth dries below. Green grapes and ripe plums. Rye breads are spiced with peaches and apples and stewed in rye boozy deliciousness. Pink and white grapefruit  raw and unfettered without any added sugar. Candied ginger and cumin mingle amidst the oak, grapes, and grapefruit.

Palate: oak, spice, rye, peach, and apricot all as one and one as all. Long grapefruit finish with oak and whispers of grape musk and barnyard dust and funk. Biggest flavor profile in the middle. Lovely  screams for food. Silky and slightly sticky in the middle. Candied sugar along the edges.

Final Thoughts: holy pocky, Mikkeller has done it again. Fantastic! My only regret is that I didnt buy more bottles of this fantastic beer.

Une dégustation offerte par rodenbach99.  Merci Yan pour cette bouteille monstrueusement dispendieuse.  Une robe ambrée qui sembrouille avec une coiffe beige bien montée.  Un début de dentelle.  Un nez franchement fruité avec du pamplemousse et des raisins.   Des effluves dorge sucré ou de sucre candi.  Des parfums de bretts qui poussent dans les replis des saveurs fruitées.  Une bouche de fruits acidulés et de saveurs boisées qui développent des soubresaults asséchants.  Limpression sucrée est de ce fait atténuée et tout à fait correcte pour mes papilles.  Une sensation très agréable sur le palais.  Un pétillement doux qui sinsère dans un corps qui possède quelques rondeurs cachées.  Une texture qui me semble être huileuse.  Une finale florale de brettanomyces et de pamplemousse.  Une belle affaire.

Bouteille de 750ml capsulée comme un Champagne mais avec le bouchon en plastique. Cette bouteille a été partagée avec Slovaksniper. La robe est cuivrée avec une mousse beige durable, ce nest pas un gusher. Le nez est agréable avec un beau boisé et du caramel fruité. La bouche le liquide est vineux, il goûte le bois, les fruits. Il y a du caramel fruité. Le bois lui confère des tannins quelque peu astringents. Les bretts sont présents mais ils procurent une autre dimension. Elle se boit tout seul. Bouteille meilleure avant le 04/05/2021.

Bottle: Poured a bright cloudy amber color ale with a large dirty white foamy head with good retention and some good lacing. Aroma of Brett notes with funky yeast and light dry vinous notes is very intriguing. Taste is also dominated by dry vinous notes with grassy notes and some funky ester with what seems like Brett notes  extremely complex and somewhat hard to do justice of the taste with my descriptions. Body is quite full with good carbonation and no apparent alcohol. Very complex while retaining good drinkability level. I would love to have this one again in the future.

Bottle, shared with tmrmwel and Inbreak @ Henrik, Bergen. Pours a slightly hazy deep orange body with a huge creamy off-white head. Very nice indeed. Aroma is elderflowers, white currants, heather, wood, hints of brettanomyces and some juniper-like herbalness. Very fresh and highly inviting. First up on tasting is a pine-like herbal grassiness, then white currants and grapefruit get in the mix, followed by hints of moss and candy sugars. In the end, this remarkable beer gets dry and woody with a mild bretty and tart finish. Subtle, original, complex and very nice. I can see why this is among Mikkels own favorite beers.

Brown bottle, 750 ml, best before 04/05/21, via Importations Privées Bièropholie (merci Hughes!), savoured on July 7 2012; eye: caramel, semi-opaque, suspended matter, no effervescence, voluminous beige head that turns into a tiny sheet, nice lacing; nose: grapefruit, light woody, slight Brettanomyces yeast, white wine, tangerine; mouth: grapefruit, light woody, slight Brettanomyces yeast, white wine, light sourness, spices, tangerine, really dry finale in grapefruit with presence of Brettanomyces yeast, medium body, good carbonation, lightly bitter, slick texture; overall: quite fine

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 750 ml, meilleure avant 04/05/21, via Importations Privées Bièropholie (merci Hughes!), savourée le 7 juillet 2012; il : caramel, semi-opaque, matière en suspension, pas deffervescence, mousse beige abondante qui se transforme en une minuscule couverture, bonne dentelle; nez : pamplemousse, léger boisé, très léger levure Brettanomyces, vin blanc, tangerine; bouche : pamplemousse, léger boisé, très léger levure Brettanomyces, vin blanc, légère aigreur, épices, tangerine, finale très sèche en pamplemousse avec présence de levure Brettanomyces, corps moyen, bonne carbonatation, légèrement amère, texture coulante; en résumé : bien bon

750 ml caged and corked bottle.  Served in a Unibroue tulip, the beer pours a cloudy burnt orange color with about an inch and a half off-white head that stayed around for a while.  Theres also a decent amount of lacing.  Aroma is nice and fruity, the brew smells like grapes, tropical fruit, green apples, sauvignon blanc wine, funk, lemon peel, pears, and some earthy aromas.  It tastes like sauvignon blanc wine/grapes, funk, oak, lemon peel, yeast, hay, green apples and a bit of apricot.  Mouthfeel/body is light/medium, it has high but also soft carbonation which helps makes this brew easy to drink.  I think this is a pretty good beer.  Its pricey at $19.99 a bottle, but I think its definitely worth trying even at that price.

750 ml paper-wrapped bottle from The Wine and Cheese Place. Pours a hazy amber with a finger of off-white head. Sauvignon blanc is right up front in the aroma, with tart citrus, tropical fruits, caramel malts, bretty funk, and some grass and herbs. Flavor has the same sauvignon blanc, bretty funk, tart, citrusy, and tropical fruits, caramel, candi sugar, and oak. Medium-full bodied, with medium carbonation and a funky mouthfeel. Really tasty and complex.

Bottle shared on the bus ride to The Festival in MA. Pours a deep, murky brown body with thin light brown lacing. Aroma is sweet citrus fruits and delicious tangy funk. Mouthfeel is dry and crisp with notes of nice dry citrus, funk, sour fruits, wine, and yeast.

75 cl bottle @ Olutravintola Pikkulintu. Rated on 4.12.2010
Aroma is rather nice and rich with exotic fruits, some biscuits and hints of berries and sourness. Flavour is sourish white wine notes, some hops with exotic fruitness, hints of caramel and citrus. Not sure if I like this or not.

Bottle, shared with Club Gonzo. Now also (at least almost) live and direct. Pours a caramelly orange, with a thick creamy head. Very nice aroma with brett, green apples, grapes and a sour-ish oakines. A full, slick body, with soft carbonation. Sweet, rather complex flavour, with notes of orange peel, vanilla, dark fruits, syrup candi sugar and yeast. It finishes of with almost vinous dry sour notes.

pours cloudy medium dark brown with a decent foamy sizable head, a multitude of slow-moving CO2 streams. Fruity muscat grape on the nose. Drinks with a subdued sourness (6/10), creamy mouthfeel, tastes of muscat grape, medium malts, a persisting sweetness (8/10), and then transitions into an IPA-like tangerine citrus, hops, and lingering bitterness (6/10). Med-high complexity, med-high depth, great transitions, good carry, very nice drinkability. Im astounded by the wine-beer fusion, and it works very well here.

Bottle: Thanks Nick:
Medium bigger vast slow disappearing creamy white head on top of a deep dark hazy to murky amber colored beer.
Smell is delicious: nice nice sauvin hops, hop fruits, citrus, mango, peach, yeast, alcohol. Good smell! Delicious smell.
Taste hops, lovely nelson sauvin, hop fruits, abricot, peach, grape fruit, soft creamy spices, fruity yeast, some touches of yeast, barley malts and a nice bitternes.
Aftertaste of hops and hop fruits, hop bitter, spices, some sweet hop notes.
Low carbo, soft light dry spicy mouthfeel, full body and a creamy texture.
Delicious beer.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottle. Pours a hazy copper brown, patchy small creamy head. Aroma of Bret, white wine, light fruits, funk, some sherbet (candy). Flavour is mainly white wine, light fruits, apple, pear, funk, Bret and lemon zest. Complex, interesting, with a dry finish. Not comparable to any other beer I have had - thus far.

30th January 2010Cloudy amber beer. White head. White wine nose with a touch of blackcurrant. Light dry palate, crisp and fresh. Blackcurrant underpinned by fresh grapes and whispers of tangerine and orange. Finishes dry, light and airy. More of the same flavours in the aftertaste. Like a fine white wine with a drop of blackcurrant liquer added. Extraodinary beer!

750 ml bottle. Pale yellow gold pour with frothy white head. Aroma is quite winey, definitely smells like sauvignon blanc with belgian yeast, and citrusy hops, especially lemon. White wine both in aroma and taste, like drinking champagne but much better. Taste is relatively light, good belgian yeast spicyness, lots of sauvignon, hoppy finish. Palate is lively, tasty yet still refreshing and enjoyable. Delicious.

Smells like a sauvignon with a strong Belgian yeast presence. Beautiful fruit on nose. Darker than expected, dark amber brown.  Taste is easy smooth fruity and very similar to a sauvignon blanched with more displayed oak. Very pretty and impressive.

From bottle at Cardinal. Pours hazy golden with a huge creamy off-white head. Aroma of wood, yeast, brett, and some light grapefruity hops as well. Taste is smooth, yet complex,initially sweet, turns light sour, good brett, white wine, fresh juicy sweet grapes, dry barrel towards the end, very good, interesting and well balanced beer, something different, but good.

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2012 Fra flaske (holdbar til 04/05/21!) på Mikkellertreffet på Cardinal: et av de øl M. selv er mest glad i, og det er lett å forstå.  Eksepsjonelt god, kompleks og full av nyanser. Selv skummet alene er nydelig. Det perfekte øl til store anledninger i stedet for champagne. Brygget hos de Prouf og lagret på hvitvinsfat. Enkel maltoppskrift, lav mesketemp, enzymer, champ.gjær og brett. FG 1002, 9%.
Doftar blomster - rosor, maskrosor. Örter och vitt vin. Härligt bubblig och uppfriskande. Ganska torr finish och tyvärr lite kort men bara Lite kort eftersmak. Slutsats; god som in i bomben!

UPDATED: JUL 5, 2013 bottle pour in a blind wine flight at F12 Restaurant in Stockholm.  allow me to gloat a bit, because blind I picked it out as a Mikkeller, though not solely due to the flavor and aroma and mouthfeel.  it certainly had the same dirty gravel and egg shell yeast character as other Mikkeller products, and the same harsh malt, and the same overblown hop nose, and the same syrupy, goopy body as other Mikkeller beers.  but what made me sure was that this is precisely the kind of beer that a fancy pants restaurant *would* add as a ringer in their blind wine flight to showcase something interesting and unique happening in the world of beer. Brett character was mild; hops lended it some more mustiness and gave it a pinecone / tree bark character as well, and speaking of bark, thats probably also how the barrels came through, muddled and lost in the clash of flavors.  Vinous for sure, but more sweet than dry.  These Mikkeller beers need some seriously cleaning.

Bottle. Poured a clear brown color with a large creamy light brown head that was mostly lasting with excellent lacing. Moderate to heavy sour, woody and leaves aroma. Medium body to full body with a tingly dry texture and soft carbonation. Moderate to heavy complex sweet & sour flavor with a medium to heavy sour & sweet finish of average to long duration. This beer exceeded my expectations.

Bottle at home, from my Minneapolis Town Hall glass. Holy shit is this a nice beer!!! Pours cloudy puice, a greenish, orangish, tawny brown that is a truly wretched colour to behold! Thick off-white head, fine lacing. I love this beer, but its the same colour as my dachshunds diarrhoea... Gross. Nose is. Just stunning; lemongrass, citrus, soapstone, white wine, gooseberry, vanilla, brioche, just an amazing nose, a rare 10 for me... Flavours of citrus, barrel, lemon, almost salty, champagne like carbonation, round and lush, yet hoppy and bright. Just a stunning effort all the way around.

Bottle from Knightly Spirits on orange blossom.  Amber pour with a fluffy head.  Aroma of grape, funk and caramel.  Tastes are big peach and grapefruit with white wine, earth and funk.  Finishes dry with grapefruit sour.  Good.

Bottle shared at my 30:th birthday tasting on May 5 (30 år av Surt). Bottle bought @ Ølbutikken. Pours deep reddish golden with a huge frothy offwhite head that slowly dissipates while leaving some thick lacing and trace on the glass. Smell is sweet with caramel, pineapple, apricots, mango, lemon zest, wood, ripe grapes, orange juice and alcohol. Taste is sweet, fruity, bitter and tiny metallic with grapes, mango, lemon zest, orange zest, yeasty esters, apricots, pineapple and hints of brett. Mouthfeel is round, sticky sweet, tiny boozy, tiny tart and medium to full bodied. Finish is tiny sweet and tart with apricots, lemon zest, mango and pineapple.

Bottle via Matty and Mark, thanks! Pours a deep purple/off purple to brown color with pinkish head. Aroma is very wine like with oak and slight bits of citrus and hops. Taste is extremely complex. Starts off with slight sourness, grape skin, oak and moves on to loads of red wine taste with some minor white wine dryness. Finish is slightly sweet to overly sweet which was the thing that didnt quite fit with the rest of the taste. The mouth feel was awesome as Im really digging wine elements in beer and this has that feel.  Overall, damn is this complex but in almost every way this is a good thing. Would definitely look for this one again.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text:
Bottle at "30 år av surt", on May 5, 2012 in Göteborg.
Orangée, légère brume, col beige.
Arôme de Nelson bien là pour ce léger bouquet vin blanc et barrique.
En bouche, barrique de vin, dose de brett, le tout profitant de ce côté levure belge qui se démarque au palais. On a donc une belle combinaison entre le belge, nouveau zélandais et autrichien pour le vin blanc. Une pointe de douceur résiduelle à noter?

Pours a hazy amber orange with nice frothy head. Aroma is sweet bread, oak, fruit - grapes, and hint of funk. Taste is sweet caramel for a split second then turns into tart Brett with a nice white wine oaky finish.  Loved this!

30 år surt. Pours cloudy amber with a small off white head leaving some lacing. Aroma is sweet malty caramel hoppy grassy. Flavor is dry hoppy malty in front sweetness acidy sour and bitter n middle more pungent peppery and some vinegar. Finishes peppery bitter and dry.

Pours a dark golden orange color with a massive three finger white head that slowly settles into a lasting ring. Large chunks of soapy lacing left behind. 

Slightly earthy, funky aroma with a prominent musty brett character that nicely compliments the barrel presence and estery notes. Subtle barnyard character with some grass and hay along with toasted oak and light vinous fruit. Perfume with the sweetness of the white wine coming through. Smells really nice. 

Medium bodied with a nice balance of wine barrel, funky brett and light fruit. A decent amount of musty funk from the Brett but it isnt as strong as I expected. The wine barrel flavor is very strong with some dry toasted oak and sweet vinous fruit. The dryness of the oak goes very nicely with the dry brett. Theres a subtle bready yeast character that adds another dimension to the palate. Pretty sweet from the wine and faint heat toward the finish. ABV is well masked however, making this complex, well balanced beer easy to drink. One of the better Mikkeller beers Ive had in a while.

OOOOH FAWKING WOW!!! The aroma is epic!! hazy amber brew with a long lasting white crown......15min later and Im still smelling WHY DOES THIS SMELL SO GOOD???!?!?! Grape juice, hop yum! Peach, Belgian funk. The white wine shows up and vanishes from sip to sip. So much grape juice. Dam this be tasty. WHY OH WHY IS IT 22$ a bottle! Nelson Sauvignon are to kill your ediot blond friend on the couch for. This beer is epic. Funky hops are good hops...Kind of dry.
750 ml. Bottle. Pours dark murky orange,  nice refreshing tart lightly sour.  Orange zest and lemon peel.

Bottle to oversized snifter. Looks good; like a Flanders red with lots of head. Smells good; sweet and spicy. Tastes pretty good; mellowed than most wilds. Mouthfeel is okay. More Mikkeller mediocracy at Cantillon prices.

Bottle @ Studenterhus, Århus.Pours dark golden with a creamy offwhite head. Aroma is lighty sour with lots of fruit, lemonpeel, green grapes, grassy hops, white wine notes, oak, yeast. Taste is sweeter at first with malt, ligh caramel notes, then overtaken by the tart fruity hops, yeasty, grapes, oak, lemonpeel. Medium body, lively carbonation, lasting very dry finish. Wonderfull, flavorfull, complex and easy drinking beer. 210412

Bottle: pour is murky golden with with a chunky off white head in this glass. It does retain well, and there is some sticky lacing here. The nose is Brett, peaches, grapefruit rind, with some vinousness present. The flavor profile is pretty spectacular. More fruity peach and grapefruit, some lighter caramel sweetness, light barrel treatment, vinousness..
The mouthfeel is soft, elegant, and overall fantastic.

Bottle at Brewdog Bar. Pours golden with a good head. The nose has tart yoghurt, lemons. The taste has more of the citrus with a big savoury note too! The palate is clean and dry the whole way through with great balance. Overall, a great beer.

Thanks to Ethan for sharing! Fulsome dark orange pour with a lively, sticky head and a pleasantly perky mouthfeel, acetic and dry here, spicy there. Tons of pink grapefruit in the nose with some horsey funk and super dry notes in there too. Taste is really fine, sort of like a blend of Prosecco, a hoppy West Coast saison, and homebrewed Izzy Prox. Digs.

Bottle, 75 cl, shared among friend. Pours dark orange, cloudy not to say murky, with a rocky off-white head. Might not be the most pretty beer, Ive had, but ghee, its delicious. Vineous! Slightly tart fruity aroma with toasted bready malt notes, yeast, peach, lemon, grapes, herbs, exotic fruits. Very creamy mouthfeel - light sweet, medium to heavy bitter, light citric, with a very dry, bitter yet fruty and super crisp finish. Lively carbonation. Quite hard to describe the sensation, very complex yet refreshing. One more, please.

75 cl bottle - Pours light hazy orange with a tiny head (off-white). Nose is exotic fruit (passion fruits!, pineapple and grapefruit) - some hints of wood and sauvignon blanc (grassy notes). Medium body with fresh undertone all the way, appealing bitterness kicks in in the end... Great beer!
Hazed orange pour with frothy tan head and lace. Brown sugar and sour malt aroma. Brown sugar and sweet malt dominate the flavor. Medium light body with good carbonation.

Head: large, foamy/bubbly, off white 
Colour: caramel/amber 
Smell: very fruity and mild hopy, slight bitterness, bit of sweetness, smells a bit exotic, grapes, mango, bit of passionfruit, bit of vanilla as well 
Taste: start is quite bitter and dry, bit of irony and yeast comes in too, second is a little bit of that exotic you get in the aroma but that quickly dissappears, for a slightly sour , dry hopy flavour , u can really taste the sauvignon blanc very well in this beer , the fruity flavour of a sauvignon blanc really hits thru, the end is that tipical dry white wine , slightly sweet taste, aftertaste is a bit of booze , but that makes place for a very very long fresh green grassy taste , Mikkel this one is awesome , and i like it even better than your Mielcke og Hurtigkarl !! superb !

Bottle, shared with mmmIPA.Beautiful red-orange colour, translucent, with a golden meringue that settles into rocky flotsam and leaves patches of lace. The aroma is awesome! Totally funky-- barnyard, gooseberries, peach tart, caramel, but ooooh, I love the funk! Sourish entry that makes my saliva glands start working, gooseberry tartness, sweet fruits that I cant identify but so good! The end is definitely a little lactic, and has a leathery musty dryness that balances things out. Holy shit I love this beer! Its a little of this, a little of that, not quite a sour, not really a fruit beer... Really unique, sublimely balanced, and really interesting. Loved it!
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Bottle. Pour is clear copper with a large off-white head.  Aroma is bretty, light caramel malt, light champagne dryness, lite wood, and light resinous hops.  Flavor is true to nose with a few more berry notes as well as a slightly more bright hop presence than expected. Also notes of dry wine, citrus, and a clean champagne dry finish. Not a boring beer.

Bottle from wlv. Pours a clear rich amber with an off white head that dissipates slowly to the edges and laces. Aroma has a bit of grassy and citrus hops with a bit of sweet grains and a strong dry white wine note. Flavor is full of sweet grains and citrus with a good amount of  with a bit of tartness, hops and dry white wine in the finish.

Shared with brewengineer for his 30th birthday.  Near clear Orange pour with ample khaki head.  Great citrus grapefruit apricot aroma.  Flavor is very vinous and like a chardonay, hint of wood, Belgian yeast.  Very awesome.  Dry and bubbly.  Definitely my favorite of the beer champagnes that Ive ever had.

Well well well well. N-S rule. Sediment filled dark brew with a bit of red hue, big big thick medium tan compact velvety cap with thick blankets of lacing. The nose is an immediate blast of papaya, flowers, candy lemon, grapefruit, common Brett funk, fuzzy peaches, zip and citrus. Good times. Funk and bitter for the taste and an odd spice hit, bit of white wine,
Floral, lemon rinds, pineapple, weak pepper. Very good bit falling asleep. Have to get rid Of brad before he has roo

Bottle. Big thanks to Suprchunk. Cloudy orange amber color with a big off-white head. The nose is wonderfully yeasty, funky fruits, grapes, sugar. The taste is bretty goodness. Dry wine-like grape flavors, funky bruised fruits. Some floral hops. Lovely tang on the dry finish. Complex but very drinkable. Medium body, active carbonation. Overall, a great beer. I had balked at the price, but Im now very happy to have tried this. One Ill certainly look to have again.

Bottle at Mogwai. Helsingborg, December 2011. 

Sourish and tart aroma of white wine, grapes, apples, citurs fruits and melon. Very refreshing with some hoppy notes. I love the funky brett character in this beer. The crisp body and the rich taste is fantastic.

I drank this beast by myself while playing PS3. Quickly too - it affected my gaming abilities - always a positive. Sedimented very deep opaque golden. Smallish fading white head. Highly aromatic ale with a basket of tropical fruits and delicious juicy white grape touches that are attractive and contributing much complexity. Surprisingly tannic, tea-like hops do provide an interesting counterpoint where the grape would naturally call for acidity. I was going to stop describing it here but the nose is like no other I have smelled; very white vinous, typical gooseberry, dry flowers, light resinous pine, bretty funk, some, kiwi, and faint toasted vanilla. The flavor is similar with some buttery oak, faint toasted vanilla notes, similar fruity notes as the nose, dry floral and leaves, light pine, tart brett, and just a bit of funk; the bitterness is more than moderate as well as the acidity. The palate is moderate, less than lively, creamy, and bone dry. The finish is longer than expected, bone dry, slightly bitter, tart acidity, leafy notes, and a bit resinous.

This was really unique and really pretty good. In retrospect I should have shared it. Oh well.

Bottle shared at RBWG 2012. Pours a cloudy orange copper with small frothy off white head. The aroma is floral hops and honey. Medium mouthfeel with a yeast and dry finish. A decent Belgiam strong ale from Mikkeller.

In bottle. Pours a golden brown colour with a thick beige head. A big Brett aroma with white wine, oak, passion fruit and leather. Similar flavours. Mildly bitter with lingering oak and passion fruit again. Quite vinous with heavy carbonation with a foamy mouth-feel. Lovely.

bottle at home .. thanks to the Dynamic Duo ... copper ... light tan head ... load of brett ... light fruit hop nose... little fizz ... zezty fruits ... big orange ... light passion fruit ... soft brett ... nice but not the WOW others have said
750ml- pour is a dark copper- Nose is pineapple, white grape..Taste is apple,citrus,hay, tropical fruits ..Palate is dry and tart.

Big lambic nose like a barnyard. some wine notes in the nose
Pours amber and cloudy. big 1.5" head. Notes of wine, lemon,and sour aplle flavours with a carmelly malt and a big hop finish. Sour lambic flavours disguise the alcohol until it hits the back of your throat. Not a huge lambic fan but this is a pretty good one.

750ml corked bottle pours a cloudy amber color with 2 fingers of off-white head that leaves some spots of lacing on the glass.  Aroma is light caramel malts and some yeast with some fruit.  Taste is light fruity and malty sweetness with some light bitter hops and some sourness in the finish.  Medium body and adequate carbonation leave a nice tingle.  Not quite what I was expecting.

Pours a murky dark amber. Aroma is huge; pineapple, guava, kiwi, lemon, lime, all your typical Southern Hemisphere Sauvignon grape aromas, mixed with a great brett funkyness. This all flows through to the taste, with a great carbonation, sweetness, tart cooking apple & acidity. Finish is dry, acidic and fruity. An amazing beer!
Nice beer.  Aroma is white grapes, caramel, light onions, grass, and lemon.  Taste is citrus fruits and white grapes with a very fizzy body.  Finishes very dry and crisp.
Complex dry white grapes, acidic, impressive but not memorable. Plainish.

Bottle at home. Reddish amber, thick creamy white head. Nose is slightly grape lambic, earthy vinous funkiness, hint of gooseberry hop, complex and smooth. Very slightly sweet caramel, juicy hop, hint of sour acidity, tannin even, peach, gooseberry, citrus, amazing funky hop finish. Incredible. This beer is outrageously good.

Bottle at home. Barnyardy funky aromas, with sour lambic characteristics and really distinct citrus and lemon notes. If theres a wine it tastes like it would probably something like a gewurztraminer - lychees, bits of turkish delight - along with that funkiness which makes the beer. Unique and great.

Bottle from West Lakeview Liquors. Served in a SAVOR wine glass.

Pours a clear light orange color with a good white head. Moderate amount of white lacing. Nose carries light white wine plus some funk. A bit earthy with mild funk. Light acidity comes through in the flavor. Light body with effervescent carbonation. Really quite good. Probably my favorite Mikkeller beer to date.

For my money the best beer Mikkel has ever created.  Loaded with nice grapefruit taste but even more fresh juicy peach.  Like those really bright orange peaches.  Lightly tart, some tannic quality.  Easy to drink for a big beer.

Slightly hazy orange-amber colored pour. Off-white, ample head. Slowly falls and leaves a good amount of sticky lacing. Huge grapefruit aroma. Slight caramel malt nose. Very tart, sweet and bitter. Big hop flavor of grapefruit. Slightly dry. Very tart aftertaste. Like sucking on a grapefruit. Pretty good.

Smells like grapefruit juice moreso than anything Ive Smelled that isnt grapefruit juice... Hazy dark amber nice white head incredible retention... Winey aroma loads of grapefruit hops... Dry dry dry dry finish very very winey grape flavor excellent lightly tart dry.... Medium body awesome

Pours an opaque amber with a medium ttan head...nice lacing and retention.  Aroma has sweet fruit juice...grape with some pear...a faint hint of musty leather...very faint whitw wine note.  Flavor has more plum but not sweet...some pear...definite earthy and vinous notes...woody...dry and winey at the end.  Mouthfeel is light and silky/lively...finish is very dry and slightyl woody and vinous.
On tap at Fairbar, Århus. Golden colour with an off-white head. Aroma is peaches, tropical fruits, malt, caramel. Flavour is peaches, tropical fruit, malt, caramel, berries, sourness. Nice beer.

Bottle. Darker rust hazy orange with a fluffy eggshell head that provides nice sticky lacing. Funky and earthy hops with grapefruit rind and woodiness in the aroma. Zesty citrus win light vanilla notes and a slight earthy funkiness. Lighter fluffy body with vibrant carbonation. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2012 Just like description - dry, vinous, and delicious.  This beer does an excellent job capturing the best wine flavors and combining them with the best beer flavors.  The result is well balanced, with superb carbonation and texture.

Massive Mikkeller Pt.2. Another bottle I was pretty excited to try. Great spicy aroma with slight hints of tea and herb. Flavor was a tad "dry" but still had that winy type flavor. Very different and interesting.

Bottle via StateLine. Poured into a wine glass, muddy orange in color, with nice frosty head. Strong lacing left on the glass.  Looks like there are a lot of floaties in the beer but I think its just the haziness of the beer... Great nose of sharp tartness/sour grapes, wine, lemons. Taste is lots of lemon, sour grapes, wine, flowers, yeast notes... Leaves the mouth very dry.  Hard to believe this is a 9 percenter... so light and easy to drink. Body is light and refreshing, good amount of carbonation. Overall. Everything about this beer is great except its price tag.... Thanks to robert for intially sharing this beer! FU Shelton brothers!

750ml shared with mattyb83.  Pours a hazy caramel color with some amberish highlights and a big pillow head.  Aroma of some sour funk, citrusy white wine grapes, wet wood, brett, lemons, and funky cheese rind.  Drinks like a creamy, infected, corked wine.  In a good way though.  White grapes blast through with green apple, lemon and grapefruit notes.  Followed by some light acidity that works with a ton of wet oak.  The brett presence is there but really works to complement the huge white grape and apple skin presence.  The oak is very well integrated as well.  A very interesting beer that is just incredibly citrusy for a wild that really takes the forefront over the yeast.  I dig.

750mL bottle.  Opens with a small pop.  Slightly hazy, caramel in color with some hints of red/pink in there as well.  There is a nice, medium sized, fluffy white head, too, that leaves some nice lacing on the glass as it recedes.  Slightly tart aroma with notes of green grapes, some orange citrus.  Taste is citrusy with some orange and grapefruit, and nicely tart throughout.  Towards the finish this has elements of a sauv blanc going on, and then just dries the fuck out when it finishes.  This citrus forward wild is like nothing I have had before, and is really well done and good.  The price point is high, but this is something that I would definitely recommend to anyone who likes wilds or ipas as well.

Bottle pours amber with cream colored head. Aromas are grapes, yeasts, and sweetness. Taste is very white wine like with apples, grapes, and a toasted caramel note. Finish is long and very dry. Overall, a delicious beer.

Bottle.  Pours a creamy brown with off white head.  Aroma is sweet with some sour yeast, grape, dough, and sweet malts notes.  Palate is a bit sour and very dry, finishing dry.  The taste is a bit sweet and sour.  Very different, but very impressive.

We had this to toast in 2012, we got that goin for us. Smells awesome - apples and pears, white wine cedar and oak. Flavor is pretty much what the aroma predicts - apples and pears, some tart, lightly sour notes, prickly carbonation, woody, winey finish. Really tasty. Not sure if it was $24.99 tasty, but I really liked it...

Bottle from Beers of Europe, consumed at Isobels (lozs mum) 31.12.11   Glowing orange/amber colour with a sticky white head. Wet perfumey wood on the nose, tangy fruity with apricots and grapefruit in the mouth, also funky and with a dry & furry coating left around the gums. Not totally my thing to be honest whilst I started off by enjoying this after a while I became less enamoured with it and at £15.99 a bit pricey to feel like that, still top marks to Mikkeller for trying something like this.   A7 A4 T7 P4 Ov15   3.6

Thanks emacgee.  Hazy amber with a thin white film.  Nose of candy corn, strong cat pee, grapefruit, starfruit, grass and butter.  Flavor is mildly sweet, mildly bitter, with a strong buttery and oaky white wine like component.  Maybe a tad overcarbonated with a flavor that makes my tummy hurt.

Clear coppery body with strong carbonation. Huge offwhite head. Wooden funky gooseberry aroma with white wine grape notes. Dry-acidic wooden gooseberry pineapple taste with alcohol notes. Mid-bodied. Dryish wooden citric pineapple aftertaste with white wine notes. Nice, but didnt like the acidity. (0.75l bottle shared by hcalsos.)

750ml bottle from secret santa. Pours hazy orangish brown with white head. Aromas of grapefruit and vinous with white whine and some funk. Flavors lemon, orange, and vinous white wine notes. A little tartness in there. Not bad, didnt really work with my palate.

Bottle shared by emacgee.  Pours a dark golden orange with a white head.  Nose is hugely grapefruit, but lingering behind it is a spicy cat pee vibe.  Not strong enough to totally bother me, but distracting from the great grapefruit thing.  A decent amount of malt.  A big and very interesting beer.

Pours red orange with a profuse sandstone head. Nose is straight up pink grapefruit flesh and raw pineapple with a vinous character and super dry notes.  Very dry and citrusy with lots of pink grapefruit and some crushed black pepper.  Awesome hop character, very dry.

750mL bottle, pours a beautiful vibrant opaque orangey amber with a voluminous white head. Aroma is very vinous and yeasty, with loads of brett-like yeast, sauvignon blanc, dry lemon and orange zest with a bit of fruity notes. Flavour is incredibly complex with an amazing balance of dry white wine, brett, dry fruity notes, lemon rind - so much depth and balance, with strong lasting flavours. The barrels accentuated the complexity so expertly. Damn delicious.

I picked this up from San Diego when we took a week long vacation there. This was one of those that I felt was a bit of a prize. I had never heard of it and of course never seen it here in AZ. I saved it to share and it happened to be opened and shared today. 
I really like this beer and wish I had another. There is a sense of grapefruit and apricot just from the cork alone. The cork was synthetic. I love the mouth fill of this beer as well. It seems to be a bit frothy. There is a tiny head and some minimal lacing. It pours a light burnt orange/maybe a medium. Beautiful beer. Cheers to this beer!

75 cl. bottle. Had been saving it for special occation. Had this last night (christmas eve). Golden color. Taste is something very special, definate white wine notes, brett, a little sour and dry. Very Very nice

saw at Steins, passed- tasting! .. Pours a hazy gold .. big head, medium lacing .. . light brett, light honey, light yeast, flowers, and light white grape skin .. . really tasty beverage, could drink a bottle by myself quite easily .. . . Laurie got offended that I used the word puke, But to me, thats what her dinner tasted like.
bottle. Love this. Copper golden pour. Definate wine driven beer. Grassy sauvignon blanc like, slight weediness, white wine grapiness, honeysuckle. Lovely seek this out

The beer pours a very hazy, deep amber-chestnut color with a full, off-white, very creamy, fluffy head which is mostly lasting and leaves tight, soapy lace.  The nose is like no other I have smelled; very white vinous, typical gooseberry, dry flowers, light resinous pine, bretty funk, some, kiwi, and faint toasted vanilla.  The flavor is similar with some buttery oak, faint toasted vanilla notes, similar fruity notes as the nose, dry floral and leaves, light pine, tart brett, and just a bit of funk; the bitterness is more than moderate as well as the acidity.  The palate is moderate, less than lively, creamy, and bone dry.  The finish is longer than expected, bone dry, slightly bitter, tart acidity, leafy notes, and a bit resinous.  Not sure of the price tag, but this beer was miraculous.  The fruit notes were completely complementary to the dry brett and hop bitterness.  And the palate worked well with the flavor progression.  I am not sure how Mikkeller does it with every brew but this one was nearly perfect for this type of beer.  Amazing.

750mL bottle.  Poured medium honeyed orange with a fluffy, sticky whitish head.  The aroma picked up rich redder fruits and vinous notes accented by funky, fruity yeast, lightly-toasted oak, and lactic notes.. yeasty and a little warm on the nose.. good stuff!  The flavor opened tangy with white wine and oaky notes leading.. bready notes and tropical fruits provided sweetness at the core.. complementary sourness laced throughout (mostly oak and funky fruits).. rich, spicy fruits and much lesser earthy bitterness surrounded.. finished very dry and fruity, with resurgent vinous character.. delicious!  Medium-bodied, well-carbonated, and dry on the palate.. the hops, barrel, and Brett really worked well together.. excellent brew!

Pours a lot darker than I was expecting - Im not sure why, but I was expecting a pale light beer, not rich amber with a fantastic bit of tan foam and ample lace. The flavor is unique, and interesting blend of faint strong Belgian ale in the background, and full on brett in the foreground. Aroma is very complex as well well, toasted and vinous. Off hand, the only thing I can remember drinking that struck me to this extent was a Beatrix. That was a long time ago...
Bottle at redlight.  Awesome complexity in the aroma.  Wood, grapes, vanilla, Brent, and a little acidic aroma.  Flavor is woody, tart, and not as balanced.  Great brew.

Minty aroma with grapes and hints of sweet rosemarry.  Pours a reddish amber with a thin white head.  Tart grapes upfront with oak and vanilla notes, with sweet herbal flavors and a dry tart finish. Really nice!

In short: An oaky, grapefruity, leathery and dry golden ale that drinks like a session beer.  Wow!
How: Bottle 750ml, first batch brewed.  Consumed 1.5 after the beer release and 8.5 years before expiration date!!!
The look: Cloudy glowing golden-orange body topped by a persistent small off-white head
In long: Nose is unusual and intriguing, lots and lots of oaky wine barrel, leathery brett, dried orange peels, tropical fruits, horse blanket.  Taste is just as complex but is really not that vinous.  A lot of dried oak, dried pineaples, acidic white grapefruits, barnyard character, a slice of lemon zest, leather, a bit sandy, dry has a desert.  Very astringent finish that leaves the mouth sandy-dry.  Yet I feel that after 1.5 year that there is still some food for the brett in there and it could get even drier and more leathery.  Finish has a bitter grapefruits bitterness but I dont think it is hop related, I feel as if it is the oak and grapefruity brett joining forces to create a sharp bittterness.  No alcohol whatsoever, really hard to believe this is a 9% beer.  This is in-your-face brett and oak and yet the beer is never aggressive, I could even imagine myself downing many pints of this in a pub (and it is a 9% beer!).  The brett is not really funky here, it has a leathery and grapefruity character.  This is one of Mikkeller best creation.  I got myself a few bottles of this, but at $30 each, ouch!, this is nice but pricey treat.  But I can afford it, I saved a lot of money on car insurance by switching to Geico and then I saved even more by losing my licence because of a DUI.
Pours amber with a white head. Aroma is malt, brett, fruity and citrus hop. Flavour is malt, brett, fruity, grapefruit and citrus hop. Very complex and perfectly balanced.

Bottle. Pours cloudy golden with  white head. Aroma of  vanilla, funk, sour berries, malt, peach and fruitiness.Flavor is sweet and funky with some malt, and vanilla and oak.Medium to thin body, average carbonation.nice funky beer.

Hazy amber color with a large, white head that left nice lacing on the glass.  Aroma of vanilla, nelson, brett, wood, white wine, floral  hops, and citrus. Taste of vanilla, citrus, brett, white wine, wood, and a lightly bitter nelson finish with light alcohol.

UPDATED: JUN 29, 2016 Draught @ Mikkeller Bar, during 3Floyds Night 2011.  Hazy amber with huge white / off white head. Lovely fruity aroma of citric and exotic fruits with a great vinous touch. Tropical fruit taste, brett, dry white wine, dry finish. Lovely.

Pours light ruby amber thick with a big light tan head. The aroma is phenomenal, huge notes of Nelson hops with the funk blended so well together, almost like candy. The flavor starts with juicy wine notes from the barrel, Nelson hop notes, and then a bit of a dry, but pleasant ending with some funk to help enhance a bit.
Pink grapefruit and lilly bouquet, strong and wonderful. Cloudy copper, thick yellow head. Tangy grapefruit flavor, nothing else, but intense and delicious. I could drink this all the time.

Pours hazy amber into a snifter. Off-white head with excellent retention recedes to skim surface. Sweet sour summer fruit and brett aromas. Dry with sweet funky tropical and summer fruit upfront turning to grapefruit in the lasting sour funk finish.
Bottle shared by bhensonb. Pours reddish copper with a foamy beige head and a winey aroma. There is a sourish caramel malt flavor that leaves wine on the palate. A very elegant and tasty brew.

750 from The Davis Beer Shoppe in Davis, CA as the Brut. Purs hazy copper with a creamy foamy beige head. Aroma of light stone fruits, barnyard and floral hop. Flavor is pretty much the same. A taste is worth a thousand words. Brilliant ale.

Pours murky bronze / tawny brown with a huge light brown head that leaves quickly.  the aroma has lots of fruity/grapy Nelson Sauvignon hop characteristics, fruity Belgian yeast, sweet malt and berries - very fruity overall.  Medium / full body with lots of gentle semi-sharp carbonation.  The flavor starts very fruity like the aroma along with more of a hop presence (yep, fruity as well) and lots of peach and nectarine flavors.  The finish adds some peppery spice.  As it warms the flavor seems to get fuller, heartier and spicier.  Very nice beer.

Keg at CP&K. It pours cloudy deep amber, with a thin yellow-white head. The nose is white grape, gooseberry, tart green apple, lime, yeast and some funk. The taste is tangy white grape, kiwi, lime, green apple, gooseberry, alcohol warmth, wood, brown bread, biscuit and toast, with a dry, citrusy finish. Medium body, moderate carbonation and smooth mouth-feel. A very pleasant brew, with a nice touch of tangy tartness. Nice.

750ml bottle, wrapped in beautiful black paper with a unique black cork.  Best by date is 09/15/2019.  Im guessing this is about 1.5 years old.  The pour yields a lightly hazy, medium honey-amber body.  A thick, spongy head of beige froth is steadfast, refusing to relinquish its stronghold, and leaving hard, clumpy rings of lace all over the glass.  Pretty brew, for sure.  The nose is quite enticing, showing smooth, malty notes of biscuit, cracker dough, attenuated caramel, and Quincys yeast rolls (if you grew up in the south in the  late 80s and early 90s, you know what this is).  To that add mildly buggy brett, peppery oak, and dry, vinous white grapes.  Champagne yeast is apparent and welcomed for its dryness.  Flavors follow suit, expertly balanced between doughy, softly caramelized bread malts and dry, zingy, seasoned oak slathered in dry white wine.  Notes of bitter grasses and perhaps some dried pineapple bring gorgeous hop notes into the fold.  The palate is substantive, lightly sweet at points, and nearly bone dry at others.  Persistent, fizzy carbonation is present throughout, clearing any residual sugars out expeditiously.  It drinks way too easy for a 9% beer.  Very good stuff.  This will undoubtedly continue to evolve over time, losing hop character but gaining dryness.  I quite like it exactly where it is.

Surprisingly tannic, tea-like hops do provide an interesting counterpoint where the grape would naturally call for acidity. A fair almond skin nuttiness coats the palate as flowery fruit salad expands together with the expansive bubbles. Brettanomyces remain well integrated, not all that developed aromatically, but ensuring a fair dryness that somehow does not thin the palate out. The 9% is not all that apparent. Very balanced and very original. Delicious stuff.

My Bottom Line:
White wine and tropical fruit evolve into hop resins and brettanomyces in this classy Belgian-style strong ale.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A sheet of foam covers the cloudy deep amber.
-One of this beers admirable features is that both the barrel aging and brettanomyces are subtle, and thus very agreeable.
-Effervescence is expansive, which makes the flavor profile feel lighter.
-Earthy hop bitterness develops resinous angles.
-The tropical fruit character is akin to oranges at times.
